      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Tragedy of King Lear</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">

               </p>

                           </span>

                           </span>

                  </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>

                           </span>

                           </span>

            </div>
         </div>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LEAR, king of Britain </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">KING OF FRANCE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF BURGUNDY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF CORNWALL</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF ALBANY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF KENT</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF GLOUCESTER</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EDGAR, son to Gloucester.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EDMUND, bastard son to Gloucester.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CURAN, a courtier.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Old Man, tenant to Gloucester.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Doctor</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Fool</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">OSWALD, steward to Goneril.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Captain employed by Edmund. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Gentleman attendant on Cordelia. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Herald.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Servants to Cornwall.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">GONERIL</span>
                        <span class="personname">REGAN</span>
                        <span class="personname">CORDELIA</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">daughters to Lear.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Knights of Lear's train, Captains, Messengers, Soldiers, and
                Attendants</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE Britain.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I. King Lear's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II. The Earl of Gloucester's castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III. The Duke of Albany's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV. A hall in the same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE V. Court before the same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I. King Lear's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KENT, GLOUCESTER, and EDMUND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">I thought the king had more affected the Duke of</div>
                     <div class="line">Albany than Cornwall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">It did always seem so to us: but now, in the</div>
                     <div class="line">division of the kingdom, it appears not which of</div>
                     <div class="line">the dukes he values most; for equalities are so</div>
                     <div class="line">weighed, that curiosity in neither can make choice</div>
                     <div class="line">of either's moiety.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not this your son, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">His breeding, sir, hath been at my charge: I have</div>
                     <div class="line">so often blushed to acknowledge him, that now I am</div>
                     <div class="line">brazed to it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot conceive you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, this young fellow's mother could: whereupon</div>
                     <div class="line">she grew round-wombed, and had, indeed, sir, a son</div>
                     <div class="line">for her cradle ere she had a husband for her bed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you smell a fault?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot wish the fault undone, the issue of it</div>
                     <div class="line">being so proper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">But I have, sir, a son by order of law, some year</div>
                     <div class="line">elder than this, who yet is no dearer in my account:</div>
                     <div class="line">though this knave came something saucily into the</div>
                     <div class="line">world before he was sent for, yet was his mother</div>
                     <div class="line">fair; there was good sport at his making, and the</div>
                     <div class="line">whoreson must be acknowledged. Do you know this</div>
                     <div class="line">noble gentleman, Edmund?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord of Kent: remember him hereafter as my</div>
                     <div class="line">honourable friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">My services to your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">I must love you, and sue to know you better.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I shall study deserving.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath been out nine years, and away he shall</div>
                     <div class="line">again. The king is coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Sennet. Enter KING LEAR, CORNWALL, ALBANY, GONERIL, REGAN,
                CORDELIA, and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Attend the lords of France and Burgundy, Gloucester.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall, my liege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt GLOUCESTER and EDMUND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Meantime we shall express our darker purpose.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me the map there. Know that we have divided</div>
                     <div class="line">In three our kingdom: and 'tis our fast intent</div>
                     <div class="line">To shake all cares and business from our age;</div>
                     <div class="line">Conferring them on younger strengths, while we</div>
                     <div class="line">Unburthen'd crawl toward death. Our son of Cornwall,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, our no less loving son of Albany,</div>
                     <div class="line">We have this hour a constant will to publish</div>
                     <div class="line">Our daughters' several dowers, that future strife</div>
                     <div class="line">May be prevented now. The princes, France and Burgundy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Great rivals in our youngest daughter's love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Long in our court have made their amorous sojourn,</div>
                     <div class="line">And here are to be answer'd. Tell me, my daughters,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Since now we will divest us both of rule,</div>
                     <div class="line">Interest of territory, cares of state,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which of you shall we say doth love us most?</div>
                     <div class="line">That we our largest bounty may extend</div>
                     <div class="line">Where nature doth with merit challenge. Goneril,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our eldest-born, speak first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I love you more than words can wield the matter;</div>
                     <div class="line">Dearer than eye-sight, space, and liberty;</div>
                     <div class="line">Beyond what can be valued, rich or rare;</div>
                     <div class="line">No less than life, with grace, health, beauty, honour;</div>
                     <div class="line">As much as child e'er loved, or father found;</div>
                     <div class="line">A love that makes breath poor, and speech unable;</div>
                     <div class="line">Beyond all manner of so much I love you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span> What shall Cordelia
                        do?</div>
                     <div class="line">Love, and be silent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all these bounds, even from this line to this,</div>
                     <div class="line">With shadowy forests and with champains rich'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">With plenteous rivers and wide-skirted meads,</div>
                     <div class="line">We make thee lady: to thine and Albany's issue</div>
                     <div class="line">Be this perpetual. What says our second daughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our dearest Regan, wife to Cornwall? Speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I am made</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the self-same metal that my sister is,</div>
                     <div class="line">And prize me at her worth. In my true heart</div>
                     <div class="line">I find she names my very deed of love;</div>
                     <div class="line">Only she comes too short: that I profess</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself an enemy to all other joys,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which the most precious square of sense possesses;</div>
                     <div class="line">And find I am alone felicitate</div>
                     <div class="line">In your dear highness' love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span> Then poor Cordelia!</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet not so; since, I am sure, my love's</div>
                     <div class="line">More richer than my tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">To thee and thine hereditary ever</div>
                     <div class="line">Remain this ample third of our fair kingdom;</div>
                     <div class="line">No less in space, validity, and pleasure,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than that conferr'd on Goneril. Now, our joy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although the last, not least; to whose young love</div>
                     <div class="line">The vines of France and milk of Burgundy</div>
                     <div class="line">Strive to be interess'd; what can you say to draw</div>
                     <div class="line">A third more opulent than your sisters? Speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing will come of nothing: speak again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Unhappy that I am, I cannot heave</div>
                     <div class="line">My heart into my mouth: I love your majesty</div>
                     <div class="line">According to my bond; nor more nor less.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">How, how, Cordelia! mend your speech a little,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest it may mar your fortunes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">You have begot me, bred me, loved me: I</div>
                     <div class="line">Return those duties back as are right fit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Obey you, love you, and most honour you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why have my sisters husbands, if they say</div>
                     <div class="line">They love you all? Haply, when I shall wed,</div>
                     <div class="line">That lord whose hand must take my plight shall carry</div>
                     <div class="line">Half my love with him, half my care and duty:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sure, I shall never marry like my sisters,</div>
                     <div class="line">To love my father all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">But goes thy heart with this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, good my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">So young, and so untender?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">So young, my lord, and true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be so; thy truth, then, be thy dower:</div>
                     <div class="line">For, by the sacred radiance of the sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">The mysteries of Hecate, and the night;</div>
                     <div class="line">By all the operation of the orbs</div>
                     <div class="line">From whom we do exist, and cease to be;</div>
                     <div class="line">Here I disclaim all my paternal care,</div>
                     <div class="line">Propinquity and property of blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">And as a stranger to my heart and me</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold thee, from this, for ever. The barbarous Scythian,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or he that makes his generation messes</div>
                     <div class="line">To gorge his appetite, shall to my bosom</div>
                     <div class="line">Be as well neighbour'd, pitied, and relieved,</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou my sometime daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my liege,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, Kent!</div>
                     <div class="line">Come not between the dragon and his wrath.</div>
                     <div class="line">I loved her most, and thought to set my rest</div>
                     <div class="line">On her kind nursery. Hence, and avoid my sight!</div>
                     <div class="line">So be my grave my peace, as here I give</div>
                     <div class="line">Her father's heart from her! Call France; who stirs?</div>
                     <div class="line">Call Burgundy. Cornwall and Albany,</div>
                     <div class="line">With my two daughters' dowers digest this third:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let pride, which she calls plainness, marry her.</div>
                     <div class="line">I do invest you jointly with my power,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pre-eminence, and all the large effects</div>
                     <div class="line">That troop with majesty. Ourself, by monthly course,</div>
                     <div class="line">With reservation of an hundred knights,</div>
                     <div class="line">By you to be sustain'd, shall our abode</div>
                     <div class="line">Make with you by due turns. Only we still retain</div>
                     <div class="line">The name, and all the additions to a king;</div>
                     <div class="line">The sway, revenue, execution of the rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Beloved sons, be yours: which to confirm,</div>
                     <div class="line">This coronet part betwixt you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Giving the crown</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Royal Lear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I have ever honour'd as my king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Loved as my father, as my master follow'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">As my great patron thought on in my prayers,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">The bow is bent and drawn, make from the shaft.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it fall rather, though the fork invade</div>
                     <div class="line">The region of my heart: be Kent unmannerly,</div>
                     <div class="line">When Lear is mad. What wilt thou do, old man?</div>
                     <div class="line">Think'st thou that duty shall have dread to speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">When power to flattery bows? To plainness honour's bound,</div>
                     <div class="line">When majesty stoops to folly. Reverse thy doom;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in thy best consideration, cheque</div>
                     <div class="line">This hideous rashness: answer my life my judgment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy youngest daughter does not love thee least;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor are those empty-hearted whose low sound</div>
                     <div class="line">Reverbs no hollowness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Kent, on thy life, no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">My life I never held but as a pawn</div>
                     <div class="line">To wage against thy enemies; nor fear to lose it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy safety being the motive.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of my sight!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">See better, Lear; and let me still remain</div>
                     <div class="line">The true blank of thine eye.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by Apollo,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by Apollo, king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou swear'st thy gods in vain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, vassal! miscreant!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Laying his hand on his sword</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear sir, forbear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Do:</div>
                     <div class="line">Kill thy physician, and the fee bestow</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon thy foul disease. Revoke thy doom;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, whilst I can vent clamour from my throat,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell thee thou dost evil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me, recreant!</div>
                     <div class="line">On thine allegiance, hear me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Since thou hast sought to make us break our vow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we durst never yet, and with strain'd pride</div>
                     <div class="line">To come between our sentence and our power,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which nor our nature nor our place can bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our potency made good, take thy reward.</div>
                     <div class="line">Five days we do allot thee, for provision</div>
                     <div class="line">To shield thee from diseases of the world;</div>
                     <div class="line">And on the sixth to turn thy hated back</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon our kingdom: if, on the tenth day following,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy banish'd trunk be found in our dominions,</div>
                     <div class="line">The moment is thy death. Away! by Jupiter,</div>
                     <div class="line">This shall not be revoked.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare thee well, king: sith thus thou wilt appear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Freedom lives hence, and banishment is here.</div>
                     <p>To CORDELIA</p>
                     <div class="line">The gods to their dear shelter take thee, maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">That justly think'st, and hast most rightly said!</div>
                     <p>To REGAN and GONERIL</p>
                     <div class="line">And your large speeches may your deeds approve,</div>
                     <div class="line">That good effects may spring from words of love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus Kent, O princes, bids you all adieu;</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll shape his old course in a country new.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Flourish. Re-enter GLOUCESTER, with KING OF FRANCE, BURGUNDY, and
                Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's France and Burgundy, my noble lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord of Burgundy.</div>
                     <div class="line">We first address towards you, who with this king</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath rivall'd for our daughter: what, in the least,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you require in present dower with her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or cease your quest of love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Most royal majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">I crave no more than what your highness offer'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor will you tender less.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Right noble Burgundy,</div>
                     <div class="line">When she was dear to us, we did hold her so;</div>
                     <div class="line">But now her price is fall'n. Sir, there she stands:</div>
                     <div class="line">If aught within that little seeming substance,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or all of it, with our displeasure pieced,</div>
                     <div class="line">And nothing more, may fitly like your grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">She's there, and she is yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">I know no answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you, with those infirmities she owes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unfriended, new-adopted to our hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dower'd with our curse, and stranger'd with our oath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Take her, or leave her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, royal sir;</div>
                     <div class="line">Election makes not up on such conditions.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Then leave her, sir; for, by the power that made me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell you all her wealth.</div>
                     <p>To KING OF FRANCE</p>
                     <div class="line">For you, great king,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not from your love make such a stray,</div>
                     <div class="line">To match you where I hate; therefore beseech you</div>
                     <div class="line">To avert your liking a more worthier way</div>
                     <div class="line">Than on a wretch whom nature is ashamed</div>
                     <div class="line">Almost to acknowledge hers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING OF FRANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">This is most strange,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she, that even but now was your best object,</div>
                     <div class="line">The argument of your praise, balm of your age,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most best, most dearest, should in this trice of time</div>
                     <div class="line">Commit a thing so monstrous, to dismantle</div>
                     <div class="line">So many folds of favour. Sure, her offence</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be of such unnatural degree,</div>
                     <div class="line">That monsters it, or your fore-vouch'd affection</div>
                     <div class="line">Fall'n into taint: which to believe of her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be a faith that reason without miracle</div>
                     <div class="line">Could never plant in me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I yet beseech your majesty,--</div>
                     <div class="line">If for I want that glib and oily art,</div>
                     <div class="line">To speak and purpose not; since what I well intend,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll do't before I speak,--that you make known</div>
                     <div class="line">It is no vicious blot, murder, or foulness,</div>
                     <div class="line">No unchaste action, or dishonour'd step,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath deprived me of your grace and favour;</div>
                     <div class="line">But even for want of that for which I am richer,</div>
                     <div class="line">A still-soliciting eye, and such a tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">As I am glad I have not, though not to have it</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath lost me in your liking.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Better thou</div>
                     <div class="line">Hadst not been born than not to have pleased me
                    better.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING OF FRANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it but this,--a tardiness in nature</div>
                     <div class="line">Which often leaves the history unspoke</div>
                     <div class="line">That it intends to do? My lord of Burgundy,</div>
                     <div class="line">What say you to the lady? Love's not love</div>
                     <div class="line">When it is mingled with regards that stand</div>
                     <div class="line">Aloof from the entire point. Will you have her?</div>
                     <div class="line">She is herself a dowry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Royal Lear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give but that portion which yourself proposed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And here I take Cordelia by the hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Duchess of Burgundy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing: I have sworn; I am firm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry, then, you have so lost a father</div>
                     <div class="line">That you must lose a husband.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace be with Burgundy!</div>
                     <div class="line">Since that respects of fortune are his love,</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall not be his wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING OF FRANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Fairest Cordelia, that art most rich, being poor;</div>
                     <div class="line">Most choice, forsaken; and most loved, despised!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thee and thy virtues here I seize upon:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be it lawful I take up what's cast away.</div>
                     <div class="line">Gods, gods! 'tis strange that from their cold'st neglect</div>
                     <div class="line">My love should kindle to inflamed respect.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy dowerless daughter, king, thrown to my chance,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is queen of us, of ours, and our fair France:</div>
                     <div class="line">Not all the dukes of waterish Burgundy</div>
                     <div class="line">Can buy this unprized precious maid of me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid them farewell, Cordelia, though unkind:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou losest here, a better where to find.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast her, France: let her be thine; for we</div>
                     <div class="line">Have no such daughter, nor shall ever see</div>
                     <div class="line">That face of hers again. Therefore be gone</div>
                     <div class="line">Without our grace, our love, our benison.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, noble Burgundy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Exeunt all but KING OF FRANCE, GONERIL, REGAN, and
                CORDELIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING OF FRANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid farewell to your sisters.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The jewels of our father, with wash'd eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">Cordelia leaves you: I know you what you are;</div>
                     <div class="line">And like a sister am most loath to call</div>
                     <div class="line">Your faults as they are named. Use well our father:</div>
                     <div class="line">To your professed bosoms I commit him</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet, alas, stood I within his grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would prefer him to a better place.</div>
                     <div class="line">So, farewell to you both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Prescribe not us our duties.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Let your study</div>
                     <div class="line">Be to content your lord, who hath received you</div>
                     <div class="line">At fortune's alms. You have obedience scanted,</div>
                     <div class="line">And well are worth the want that you have wanted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Time shall unfold what plaited cunning hides:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who cover faults, at last shame them derides.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well may you prosper!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING OF FRANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, my fair Cordelia.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt KING OF FRANCE and CORDELIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Sister, it is not a little I have to say of what</div>
                     <div class="line">most nearly appertains to us both. I think our</div>
                     <div class="line">father will hence to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">That's most certain, and with you; next month with us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">You see how full of changes his age is; the</div>
                     <div class="line">observation we have made of it hath not been</div>
                     <div class="line">little: he always loved our sister most; and</div>
                     <div class="line">with what poor judgment he hath now cast her off</div>
                     <div class="line">appears too grossly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis the infirmity of his age: yet he hath ever</div>
                     <div class="line">but slenderly known himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">The best and soundest of his time hath been but</div>
                     <div class="line">rash; then must we look to receive from his age,</div>
                     <div class="line">not alone the imperfections of long-engraffed</div>
                     <div class="line">condition, but therewithal the unruly waywardness</div>
                     <div class="line">that infirm and choleric years bring with them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Such unconstant starts are we like to have from</div>
                     <div class="line">him as this of Kent's banishment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">There is further compliment of leavetaking</div>
                     <div class="line">between France and him. Pray you, let's hit</div>
                     <div class="line">together: if our father carry authority with</div>
                     <div class="line">such dispositions as he bears, this last</div>
                     <div class="line">surrender of his will but offend us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall further think on't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">We must do something, and i' the heat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II. The Earl of Gloucester's castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter EDMUND, with a letter</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou, nature, art my goddess; to thy law</div>
                     <div class="line">My services are bound. Wherefore should I</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand in the plague of custom, and permit</div>
                     <div class="line">The curiosity of nations to deprive me,</div>
                     <div class="line">For that I am some twelve or fourteen moon-shines</div>
                     <div class="line">Lag of a brother? Why bastard? wherefore base?</div>
                     <div class="line">When my dimensions are as well compact,</div>
                     <div class="line">My mind as generous, and my shape as true,</div>
                     <div class="line">As honest madam's issue? Why brand they us</div>
                     <div class="line">With base? with baseness? bastardy? base, base?</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, in the lusty stealth of nature, take</div>
                     <div class="line">More composition and fierce quality</div>
                     <div class="line">Than doth, within a dull, stale, tired bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to the creating a whole tribe of fops,</div>
                     <div class="line">Got 'tween asleep and wake? Well, then,</div>
                     <div class="line">Legitimate Edgar, I must have your land:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our father's love is to the bastard Edmund</div>
                     <div class="line">As to the legitimate: fine word,--legitimate!</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, my legitimate, if this letter speed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And my invention thrive, Edmund the base</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall top the legitimate. I grow; I prosper:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, gods, stand up for bastards!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GLOUCESTER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Kent banish'd thus! and France in choler parted!</div>
                     <div class="line">And the king gone to-night! subscribed his power!</div>
                     <div class="line">Confined to exhibition! All this done</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the gad! Edmund, how now! what news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">So please your lordship, none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Putting up the letter</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Why so earnestly seek you to put up that letter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I know no news, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">What paper were you reading?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">No? What needed, then, that terrible dispatch of</div>
                     <div class="line">it into your pocket? the quality of nothing hath</div>
                     <div class="line">not such need to hide itself. Let's see: come,</div>
                     <div class="line">if it be nothing, I shall not need spectacles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I beseech you, sir, pardon me: it is a letter</div>
                     <div class="line">from my brother, that I have not all o'er-read;</div>
                     <div class="line">and for so much as I have perused, I find it not</div>
                     <div class="line">fit for your o'er-looking.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me the letter, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall offend, either to detain or give it. The</div>
                     <div class="line">contents, as in part I understand them, are to blame.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's see, let's see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope, for my brother's justification, he wrote</div>
                     <div class="line">this but as an essay or taste of my virtue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span> 'This policy and
                        reverence of age makes</div>
                     <div class="line">the world bitter to the best of our times; keeps</div>
                     <div class="line">our fortunes from us till our oldness cannot relish</div>
                     <div class="line">them. I begin to find an idle and fond bondage</div>
                     <div class="line">in the oppression of aged tyranny; who sways, not</div>
                     <div class="line">as it hath power, but as it is suffered. Come to</div>
                     <div class="line">me, that of this I may speak more. If our father</div>
                     <div class="line">would sleep till I waked him, you should half his</div>
                     <div class="line">revenue for ever, and live the beloved of your</div>
                     <div class="line">brother, EDGAR.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Hum--conspiracy!--'Sleep till I waked him,--you</div>
                     <div class="line">should enjoy half his revenue,'--My son Edgar!</div>
                     <div class="line">Had he a hand to write this? a heart and brain</div>
                     <div class="line">to breed it in?--When came this to you? who</div>
                     <div class="line">brought it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">It was not brought me, my lord; there's the</div>
                     <div class="line">cunning of it; I found it thrown in at the</div>
                     <div class="line">casement of my closet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">You know the character to be your brother's?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">If the matter were good, my lord, I durst swear</div>
                     <div class="line">it were his; but, in respect of that, I would</div>
                     <div class="line">fain think it were not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">It is his.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">It is his hand, my lord; but I hope his heart is</div>
                     <div class="line">not in the contents.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath he never heretofore sounded you in this business?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Never, my lord: but I have heard him oft</div>
                     <div class="line">maintain it to be fit, that, sons at perfect age,</div>
                     <div class="line">and fathers declining, the father should be as</div>
                     <div class="line">ward to the son, and the son manage his revenue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">O villain, villain! His very opinion in the</div>
                     <div class="line">letter! Abhorred villain! Unnatural, detested,</div>
                     <div class="line">brutish villain! worse than brutish! Go, sirrah,</div>
                     <div class="line">seek him; I'll apprehend him: abominable villain!</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not well know, my lord. If it shall please</div>
                     <div class="line">you to suspend your indignation against my</div>
                     <div class="line">brother till you can derive from him better</div>
                     <div class="line">testimony of his intent, you shall run a certain</div>
                     <div class="line">course; where, if you violently proceed against</div>
                     <div class="line">him, mistaking his purpose, it would make a great</div>
                     <div class="line">gap in your own honour, and shake in pieces the</div>
                     <div class="line">heart of his obedience. I dare pawn down my life</div>
                     <div class="line">for him, that he hath wrote this to feel my</div>
                     <div class="line">affection to your honour, and to no further</div>
                     <div class="line">pretence of danger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Think you so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">If your honour judge it meet, I will place you</div>
                     <div class="line">where you shall hear us confer of this, and by an</div>
                     <div class="line">auricular assurance have your satisfaction; and</div>
                     <div class="line">that without any further delay than this very evening.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">He cannot be such a monster--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor is not, sure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">To his father, that so tenderly and entirely</div>
                     <div class="line">loves him. Heaven and earth! Edmund, seek him</div>
                     <div class="line">out: wind me into him, I pray you: frame the</div>
                     <div class="line">business after your own wisdom. I would unstate</div>
                     <div class="line">myself, to be in a due resolution.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I will seek him, sir, presently: convey the</div>
                     <div class="line">business as I shall find means and acquaint you
                    withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">These late eclipses in the sun and moon portend</div>
                     <div class="line">no good to us: though the wisdom of nature can</div>
                     <div class="line">reason it thus and thus, yet nature finds itself</div>
                     <div class="line">scourged by the sequent effects: love cools,</div>
                     <div class="line">friendship falls off, brothers divide: in</div>
                     <div class="line">cities, mutinies; in countries, discord; in</div>
                     <div class="line">palaces, treason; and the bond cracked 'twixt son</div>
                     <div class="line">and father. This villain of mine comes under the</div>
                     <div class="line">prediction; there's son against father: the king</div>
                     <div class="line">falls from bias of nature; there's father against</div>
                     <div class="line">child. We have seen the best of our time:</div>
                     <div class="line">machinations, hollowness, treachery, and all</div>
                     <div class="line">ruinous disorders, follow us disquietly to our</div>
                     <div class="line">graves. Find out this villain, Edmund; it shall</div>
                     <div class="line">lose thee nothing; do it carefully. And the</div>
                     <div class="line">noble and true-hearted Kent banished! his</div>
                     <div class="line">offence, honesty! 'Tis strange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the excellent foppery of the world, that,</div>
                     <div class="line">when we are sick in fortune,--often the surfeit</div>
                     <div class="line">of our own behavior,--we make guilty of our</div>
                     <div class="line">disasters the sun, the moon, and the stars: as</div>
                     <div class="line">if we were villains by necessity; fools by</div>
                     <div class="line">heavenly compulsion; knaves, thieves, and</div>
                     <div class="line">treachers, by spherical predominance; drunkards,</div>
                     <div class="line">liars, and adulterers, by an enforced obedience of</div>
                     <div class="line">planetary influence; and all that we are evil in,</div>
                     <div class="line">by a divine thrusting on: an admirable evasion</div>
                     <div class="line">of whoremaster man, to lay his goatish</div>
                     <div class="line">disposition to the charge of a star! My</div>
                     <div class="line">father compounded with my mother under the</div>
                     <div class="line">dragon's tail; and my nativity was under Ursa</div>
                     <div class="line">major; so that it follows, I am rough and</div>
                     <div class="line">lecherous. Tut, I should have been that I am,</div>
                     <div class="line">had the maidenliest star in the firmament</div>
                     <div class="line">twinkled on my bastardizing. Edgar--</div>
                     <p>Enter EDGAR</p>
                     <div class="line">And pat he comes like the catastrophe of the old</div>
                     <div class="line">comedy: my cue is villanous melancholy, with a</div>
                     <div class="line">sigh like Tom o' Bedlam. O, these eclipses do</div>
                     <div class="line">portend these divisions! fa, sol, la, mi.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, brother Edmund! what serious</div>
                     <div class="line">contemplation are you in?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thinking, brother, of a prediction I read</div>
                     <div class="line">this other day, what should follow these eclipses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you busy yourself about that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I promise you, the effects he writes of succeed</div>
                     <div class="line">unhappily; as of unnaturalness between the child</div>
                     <div class="line">and the parent; death, dearth, dissolutions of</div>
                     <div class="line">ancient amities; divisions in state, menaces and</div>
                     <div class="line">maledictions against king and nobles; needless</div>
                     <div class="line">diffidences, banishment of friends, dissipation</div>
                     <div class="line">of cohorts, nuptial breaches, and I know not what.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">How long have you been a sectary astronomical?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come; when saw you my father last?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, the night gone by.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Spake you with him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, two hours together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Parted you in good terms? Found you no</div>
                     <div class="line">displeasure in him by word or countenance?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">None at all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Bethink yourself wherein you may have offended</div>
                     <div class="line">him: and at my entreaty forbear his presence</div>
                     <div class="line">till some little time hath qualified the heat of</div>
                     <div class="line">his displeasure; which at this instant so rageth</div>
                     <div class="line">in him, that with the mischief of your person it</div>
                     <div class="line">would scarcely allay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Some villain hath done me wrong.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">That's my fear. I pray you, have a continent</div>
                     <div class="line">forbearance till the spied of his rage goes</div>
                     <div class="line">slower; and, as I say, retire with me to my</div>
                     <div class="line">lodging, from whence I will fitly bring you to</div>
                     <div class="line">hear my lord speak: pray ye, go; there's my key:</div>
                     <div class="line">if you do stir abroad, go armed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Armed, brother!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother, I advise you to the best; go armed: I</div>
                     <div class="line">am no honest man if there be any good meaning</div>
                     <div class="line">towards you: I have told you what I have seen</div>
                     <div class="line">and heard; but faintly, nothing like the image</div>
                     <div class="line">and horror of it: pray you, away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I hear from you anon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I do serve you in this business.</div>
                     <p>Exit EDGAR</p>
                     <div class="line">A credulous father! and a brother noble,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose nature is so far from doing harms,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he suspects none: on whose foolish honesty</div>
                     <div class="line">My practises ride easy! I see the business.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me, if not by birth, have lands by wit:</div>
                     <div class="line">All with me's meet that I can fashion fit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III. The Duke of Albany's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GONERIL, and OSWALD, her steward</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Did my father strike my gentleman for chiding of his
                    fool?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">By day and night he wrongs me; every hour</div>
                     <div class="line">He flashes into one gross crime or other,</div>
                     <div class="line">That sets us all at odds: I'll not endure it:</div>
                     <div class="line">His knights grow riotous, and himself upbraids us</div>
                     <div class="line">On every trifle. When he returns from hunting,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not speak with him; say I am sick:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you come slack of former services,</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall do well; the fault of it I'll answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">He's coming, madam; I hear him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Horns within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Put on what weary negligence you please,</div>
                     <div class="line">You and your fellows; I'll have it come to question:</div>
                     <div class="line">If he dislike it, let him to our sister,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose mind and mine, I know, in that are one,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not to be over-ruled. Idle old man,</div>
                     <div class="line">That still would manage those authorities</div>
                     <div class="line">That he hath given away! Now, by my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Old fools are babes again; and must be used</div>
                     <div class="line">With cheques as flatteries,--when they are seen abused.</div>
                     <div class="line">Remember what I tell you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">And let his knights have colder looks among you;</div>
                     <div class="line">What grows of it, no matter; advise your fellows so:</div>
                     <div class="line">I would breed from hence occasions, and I shall,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I may speak: I'll write straight to my sister,</div>
                     <div class="line">To hold my very course. Prepare for dinner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV. A hall in the same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KENT, disguised</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
