                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">You know not why we came to visit you,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus out of season, threading dark-eyed night:</div>
                     <div class="line">Occasions, noble Gloucester, of some poise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein we must have use of your advice:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our father he hath writ, so hath our sister,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of differences, which I least thought it fit</div>
                     <div class="line">To answer from our home; the several messengers</div>
                     <div class="line">From hence attend dispatch. Our good old friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay comforts to your bosom; and bestow</div>
                     <div class="line">Your needful counsel to our business,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which craves the instant use.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I serve you, madam:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your graces are right welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II. Before Gloucester's castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KENT and OSWALD, severally</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Good dawning to thee, friend: art of this house?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Where may we set our horses?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">I' the mire.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, if thou lovest me, tell me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">I love thee not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, I care not for thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">If I had thee in Lipsbury pinfold, I would make thee</div>
                     <div class="line">care for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Why dost thou use me thus? I know thee not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Fellow, I know thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">What dost thou know me for?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">A knave; a rascal; an eater of broken meats; a</div>
                     <div class="line">base, proud, shallow, beggarly, three-suited,</div>
                     <div class="line">hundred-pound, filthy, worsted-stocking knave; a</div>
                     <div class="line">lily-livered, action-taking knave, a whoreson,</div>
                     <div class="line">glass-gazing, super-serviceable finical rogue;</div>
                     <div class="line">one-trunk-inheriting slave; one that wouldst be a</div>
                     <div class="line">bawd, in way of good service, and art nothing but</div>
                     <div class="line">the composition of a knave, beggar, coward, pandar,</div>
                     <div class="line">and the son and heir of a mongrel bitch: one whom I</div>
                     <div class="line">will beat into clamorous whining, if thou deniest</div>
                     <div class="line">the least syllable of thy addition.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what a monstrous fellow art thou, thus to rail</div>
                     <div class="line">on one that is neither known of thee nor knows thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">What a brazen-faced varlet art thou, to deny thou</div>
                     <div class="line">knowest me! Is it two days ago since I tripped up</div>
                     <div class="line">thy heels, and beat thee before the king? Draw, you</div>
                     <div class="line">rogue: for, though it be night, yet the moon</div>
                     <div class="line">shines; I'll make a sop o' the moonshine of you:</div>
                     <div class="line">draw, you whoreson cullionly barber-monger, draw.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Drawing his sword</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Away! I have nothing to do with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Draw, you rascal: you come with letters against the</div>
                     <div class="line">king; and take vanity the puppet's part against the</div>
                     <div class="line">royalty of her father: draw, you rogue, or I'll so</div>
                     <div class="line">carbonado your shanks: draw, you rascal; come your
                    ways.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Help, ho! murder! help!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike, you slave; stand, rogue, stand; you neat</div>
                     <div class="line">slave, strike.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Beating him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">Help, ho! murder! murder!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter EDMUND, with his rapier drawn, CORNWALL, REGAN, GLOUCESTER,
                and Servants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! What's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">With you, goodman boy, an you please: come, I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">flesh ye; come on, young master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Weapons! arms! What 's the matter here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep peace, upon your lives:</div>
                     <div class="line">He dies that strikes again. What is the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">The messengers from our sister and the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">What is your difference? speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">I am scarce in breath, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">No marvel, you have so bestirred your valour. You</div>
                     <div class="line">cowardly rascal, nature disclaims in thee: a</div>
                     <div class="line">tailor made thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a strange fellow: a tailor make a man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, a tailor, sir: a stone-cutter or painter could</div>
                     <div class="line">not have made him so ill, though he had been but two</div>
                     <div class="line">hours at the trade.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak yet, how grew your quarrel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">This ancient ruffian, sir, whose life I have spared</div>
                     <div class="line">at suit of his gray beard,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou whoreson zed! thou unnecessary letter! My</div>
                     <div class="line">lord, if you will give me leave, I will tread this</div>
                     <div class="line">unbolted villain into mortar, and daub the wall of</div>
                     <div class="line">a jakes with him. Spare my gray beard, you wagtail?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, sirrah!</div>
                     <div class="line">You beastly knave, know you no reverence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, sir; but anger hath a privilege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Why art thou angry?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">That such a slave as this should wear a sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who wears no honesty. Such smiling rogues as these,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like rats, oft bite the holy cords a-twain</div>
                     <div class="line">Which are too intrinse t' unloose; smooth every passion</div>
                     <div class="line">That in the natures of their lords rebel;</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring oil to fire, snow to their colder moods;</div>
                     <div class="line">Renege, affirm, and turn their halcyon beaks</div>
                     <div class="line">With every gale and vary of their masters,</div>
                     <div class="line">Knowing nought, like dogs, but following.</div>
                     <div class="line">A plague upon your epileptic visage!</div>
                     <div class="line">Smile you my speeches, as I were a fool?</div>
                     <div class="line">Goose, if I had you upon Sarum plain,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'ld drive ye cackling home to Camelot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, art thou mad, old fellow?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">How fell you out? say that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">No contraries hold more antipathy</div>
                     <div class="line">Than I and such a knave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Why dost thou call him a knave? What's his offence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">His countenance likes me not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">No more, perchance, does mine, nor his, nor hers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, 'tis my occupation to be plain:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have seen better faces in my time</div>
                     <div class="line">Than stands on any shoulder that I see</div>
                     <div class="line">Before me at this instant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">This is some fellow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, having been praised for bluntness, doth affect</div>
                     <div class="line">A saucy roughness, and constrains the garb</div>
                     <div class="line">Quite from his nature: he cannot flatter, he,</div>
                     <div class="line">An honest mind and plain, he must speak truth!</div>
                     <div class="line">An they will take it, so; if not, he's plain.</div>
                     <div class="line">These kind of knaves I know, which in this plainness</div>
                     <div class="line">Harbour more craft and more corrupter ends</div>
                     <div class="line">Than twenty silly ducking observants</div>
                     <div class="line">That stretch their duties nicely.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, in good sooth, in sincere verity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the allowance of your great aspect,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose influence, like the wreath of radiant fire</div>
                     <div class="line">On flickering Phoebus' front,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">What mean'st by this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">To go out of my dialect, which you</div>
                     <div class="line">discommend so much. I know, sir, I am no</div>
                     <div class="line">flatterer: he that beguiled you in a plain</div>
                     <div class="line">accent was a plain knave; which for my part</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not be, though I should win your displeasure</div>
                     <div class="line">to entreat me to 't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">What was the offence you gave him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OSWALD</div>
                     <div class="line">I never gave him any:</div>
                     <div class="line">It pleased the king his master very late</div>
                     <div class="line">To strike at me, upon his misconstruction;</div>
                     <div class="line">When he, conjunct and flattering his displeasure,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tripp'd me behind; being down, insulted, rail'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And put upon him such a deal of man,</div>
                     <div class="line">That worthied him, got praises of the king</div>
                     <div class="line">For him attempting who was self-subdued;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in the fleshment of this dread exploit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Drew on me here again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">None of these rogues and cowards</div>
                     <div class="line">But Ajax is their fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetch forth the stocks!</div>
                     <div class="line">You stubborn ancient knave, you reverend braggart,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll teach you--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I am too old to learn:</div>
                     <div class="line">Call not your stocks for me: I serve the king;</div>
                     <div class="line">On whose employment I was sent to you:</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall do small respect, show too bold malice</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the grace and person of my master,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stocking his messenger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetch forth the stocks! As I have life and honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">There shall he sit till noon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Till noon! till night, my lord; and all night too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, madam, if I were your father's dog,</div>
                     <div class="line">You should not use me so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, being his knave, I will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a fellow of the self-same colour</div>
                     <div class="line">Our sister speaks of. Come, bring away the stocks!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Stocks brought out</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me beseech your grace not to do so:</div>
                     <div class="line">His fault is much, and the good king his master</div>
                     <div class="line">Will cheque him for 't: your purposed low correction</div>
                     <div class="line">Is such as basest and contemned'st wretches</div>
                     <div class="line">For pilferings and most common trespasses</div>
                     <div class="line">Are punish'd with: the king must take it ill,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he's so slightly valued in his messenger,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should have him thus restrain'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll answer that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">My sister may receive it much more worse,</div>
                     <div class="line">To have her gentleman abused, assaulted,</div>
                     <div class="line">For following her affairs. Put in his legs.</div>
                     <p>KENT is put in the stocks</p>
                     <div class="line">Come, my good lord, away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but GLOUCESTER and KENT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry for thee, friend; 'tis the duke's pleasure,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose disposition, all the world well knows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will not be rubb'd nor stopp'd: I'll entreat for thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray, do not, sir: I have watched and travell'd hard;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some time I shall sleep out, the rest I'll whistle.</div>
                     <div class="line">A good man's fortune may grow out at heels:</div>
                     <div class="line">Give you good morrow!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">The duke's to blame in this; 'twill be ill taken.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Good king, that must approve the common saw,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou out of heaven's benediction comest</div>
                     <div class="line">To the warm sun!</div>
                     <div class="line">Approach, thou beacon to this under globe,</div>
                     <div class="line">That by thy comfortable beams I may</div>
                     <div class="line">Peruse this letter! Nothing almost sees miracles</div>
                     <div class="line">But misery: I know 'tis from Cordelia,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who hath most fortunately been inform'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my obscured course; and shall find time</div>
                     <div class="line">From this enormous state, seeking to give</div>
                     <div class="line">Losses their remedies. All weary and o'erwatch'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Take vantage, heavy eyes, not to behold</div>
                     <div class="line">This shameful lodging.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fortune, good night: smile once more: turn thy wheel!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Sleeps</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III. A wood.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter EDGAR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">I heard myself proclaim'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">And by the happy hollow of a tree</div>
                     <div class="line">Escaped the hunt. No port is free; no place,</div>
                     <div class="line">That guard, and most unusual vigilance,</div>
                     <div class="line">Does not attend my taking. Whiles I may 'scape,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will preserve myself: and am bethought</div>
                     <div class="line">To take the basest and most poorest shape</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever penury, in contempt of man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Brought near to beast: my face I'll grime with filth;</div>
                     <div class="line">Blanket my loins: elf all my hair in knots;</div>
                     <div class="line">And with presented nakedness out-face</div>
                     <div class="line">The winds and persecutions of the sky.</div>
                     <div class="line">The country gives me proof and precedent</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Bedlam beggars, who, with roaring voices,</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike in their numb'd and mortified bare arms</div>
                     <div class="line">Pins, wooden pricks, nails, sprigs of rosemary;</div>
                     <div class="line">And with this horrible object, from low farms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor pelting villages, sheep-cotes, and mills,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sometime with lunatic bans, sometime with prayers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Enforce their charity. Poor Turlygod! poor Tom!</div>
                     <div class="line">That's something yet: Edgar I nothing am.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV. Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING LEAR, Fool, and Gentleman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis strange that they should so depart from home,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not send back my messenger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">As I learn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">The night before there was no purpose in them</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this remove.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail to thee, noble master!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha!</div>
                     <div class="line">Makest thou this shame thy pastime?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, ha! he wears cruel garters. Horses are tied</div>
                     <div class="line">by the heads, dogs and bears by the neck, monkeys by</div>
                     <div class="line">the loins, and men by the legs: when a man's</div>
                     <div class="line">over-lusty at legs, then he wears wooden</div>
                     <div class="line">nether-stocks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">What's he that hath so much thy place mistook</div>
                     <div class="line">To set thee here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">It is both he and she;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your son and daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">No.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, yea.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, they would not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, they have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">By Jupiter, I swear, no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">By Juno, I swear, ay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">They durst not do 't;</div>
                     <div class="line">They could not, would not do 't; 'tis worse than murder,</div>
                     <div class="line">To do upon respect such violent outrage:</div>
                     <div class="line">Resolve me, with all modest haste, which way</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mightst deserve, or they impose, this usage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Coming from us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, when at their home</div>
                     <div class="line">I did commend your highness' letters to them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere I was risen from the place that show'd</div>
                     <div class="line">My duty kneeling, came there a reeking post,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stew'd in his haste, half breathless, panting forth</div>
                     <div class="line">From Goneril his mistress salutations;</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver'd letters, spite of intermission,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which presently they read: on whose contents,</div>
                     <div class="line">They summon'd up their meiny, straight took horse;</div>
                     <div class="line">Commanded me to follow, and attend</div>
                     <div class="line">The leisure of their answer; gave me cold looks:</div>
                     <div class="line">And meeting here the other messenger,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose welcome, I perceived, had poison'd mine,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Being the very fellow that of late</div>
                     <div class="line">Display'd so saucily against your highness,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Having more man than wit about me, drew:</div>
                     <div class="line">He raised the house with loud and coward cries.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your son and daughter found this trespass worth</div>
                     <div class="line">The shame which here it suffers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                     <div class="line">Winter's not gone yet, if the wild-geese fly that way.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fathers that wear rags</div>
                     <div class="line">Do make their children blind;</div>
                     <div class="line">But fathers that bear bags</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall see their children kind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fortune, that arrant whore,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er turns the key to the poor.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, for all this, thou shalt have as many dolours</div>
                     <div class="line">for thy daughters as thou canst tell in a year.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, how this mother swells up toward my heart!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hysterica passio, down, thou climbing sorrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy element's below! Where is this daughter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">With the earl, sir, here within.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Follow me not;</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Made you no more offence but what you speak of?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">None.</div>
                     <div class="line">How chance the king comes with so small a train?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou hadst been set i' the stocks for that</div>
                     <div class="line">question, thou hadst well deserved it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, fool?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll set thee to school to an ant, to teach thee</div>
                     <div class="line">there's no labouring i' the winter. All that follow</div>
                     <div class="line">their noses are led by their eyes but blind men; and</div>
                     <div class="line">there's not a nose among twenty but can smell him</div>
                     <div class="line">that's stinking. Let go thy hold when a great wheel</div>
                     <div class="line">runs down a hill, lest it break thy neck with</div>
                     <div class="line">following it: but the great one that goes up the</div>
                     <div class="line">hill, let him draw thee after. When a wise man</div>
                     <div class="line">gives thee better counsel, give me mine again: I</div>
                     <div class="line">would have none but knaves follow it, since a fool gives it.</div>
                     <div class="line">That sir which serves and seeks for gain,</div>
                     <div class="line">And follows but for form,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will pack when it begins to rain,</div>
                     <div class="line">And leave thee in the storm,</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will tarry; the fool will stay,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let the wise man fly:</div>
                     <div class="line">The knave turns fool that runs away;</div>
                     <div class="line">The fool no knave, perdy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Where learned you this, fool?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                     <div class="line">Not i' the stocks, fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter KING LEAR with GLOUCESTER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Deny to speak with me? They are sick? they are weary?</div>
                     <div class="line">They have travell'd all the night? Mere fetches;</div>
                     <div class="line">The images of revolt and flying off.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetch me a better answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">My dear lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">You know the fiery quality of the duke;</div>
                     <div class="line">How unremoveable and fix'd he is</div>
                     <div class="line">In his own course.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Vengeance! plague! death! confusion!</div>
                     <div class="line">Fiery? what quality? Why, Gloucester, Gloucester,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'ld speak with the Duke of Cornwall and his wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, my good lord, I have inform'd them so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Inform'd them! Dost thou understand me, man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my good lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">The king would speak with Cornwall; the dear father</div>
                     <div class="line">Would with his daughter speak, commands her service:</div>
                     <div class="line">Are they inform'd of this? My breath and blood!</div>
                     <div class="line">Fiery? the fiery duke? Tell the hot duke that--</div>
                     <div class="line">No, but not yet: may be he is not well:</div>
                     <div class="line">Infirmity doth still neglect all office</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereto our health is bound; we are not ourselves</div>
                     <div class="line">When nature, being oppress'd, commands the mind</div>
                     <div class="line">To suffer with the body: I'll forbear;</div>
                     <div class="line">And am fall'n out with my more headier will,</div>
                     <div class="line">To take the indisposed and sickly fit</div>
                     <div class="line">For the sound man. Death on my state! wherefore</div>
                     <p>Looking on KENT</p>
                     <div class="line">Should he sit here? This act persuades me</div>
                     <div class="line">That this remotion of the duke and her</div>
                     <div class="line">Is practise only. Give me my servant forth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go tell the duke and 's wife I'ld speak with them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, presently: bid them come forth and hear me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or at their chamber-door I'll beat the drum</div>
                     <div class="line">Till it cry sleep to death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have all well betwixt you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">O me, my heart, my rising heart! but, down!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                     <div class="line">Cry to it, nuncle, as the cockney did to the eels</div>
                     <div class="line">when she put 'em i' the paste alive; she knapped 'em</div>
                     <div class="line">o' the coxcombs with a stick, and cried 'Down,</div>
                     <div class="line">wantons, down!' 'Twas her brother that, in pure</div>
                     <div class="line">kindness to his horse, buttered his hay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CORNWALL, REGAN, GLOUCESTER, and Servants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow to you both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail to your grace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>KENT is set at liberty</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad to see your highness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Regan, I think you are; I know what reason</div>
                     <div class="line">I have to think so: if thou shouldst not be glad,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would divorce me from thy mother's tomb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sepulchring an adultress.</div>
                     <p>To KENT</p>
                     <div class="line">O, are you free?</div>
                     <div class="line">Some other time for that. Beloved Regan,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy sister's naught: O Regan, she hath tied</div>
                     <div class="line">Sharp-tooth'd unkindness, like a vulture, here:</div>
                     <p>Points to his heart</p>
                     <div class="line">I can scarce speak to thee; thou'lt not believe</div>
                     <div class="line">With how depraved a quality--O Regan!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, sir, take patience: I have hope.</div>
                     <div class="line">You less know how to value her desert</div>
                     <div class="line">Than she to scant her duty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, how is that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot think my sister in the least</div>
                     <div class="line">Would fail her obligation: if, sir, perchance</div>
                     <div class="line">She have restrain'd the riots of your followers,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis on such ground, and to such wholesome end,</div>
                     <div class="line">As clears her from all blame.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">My curses on her!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sir, you are old.</div>
                     <div class="line">Nature in you stands on the very verge</div>
                     <div class="line">Of her confine: you should be ruled and led</div>
                     <div class="line">By some discretion, that discerns your state</div>
                     <div class="line">Better than you yourself. Therefore, I pray you,</div>
                     <div class="line">That to our sister you do make return;</div>
                     <div class="line">Say you have wrong'd her, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Ask her forgiveness?</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you but mark how this becomes the house:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Dear daughter, I confess that I am old;</div>
                     <p>Kneeling</p>
                     <div class="line">Age is unnecessary: on my knees I beg</div>
                     <div class="line">That you'll vouchsafe me raiment, bed, and food.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sir, no more; these are unsightly tricks:</div>
                     <div class="line">Return you to my sister.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Rising</span> Never, Regan:</div>
                     <div class="line">She hath abated me of half my train;</div>
                     <div class="line">Look'd black upon me; struck me with her tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most serpent-like, upon the very heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">All the stored vengeances of heaven fall</div>
                     <div class="line">On her ingrateful top! Strike her young bones,</div>
                     <div class="line">You taking airs, with lameness!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, sir, fie!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">You nimble lightnings, dart your blinding flames</div>
                     <div class="line">Into her scornful eyes! Infect her beauty,</div>
                     <div class="line">You fen-suck'd fogs, drawn by the powerful sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">To fall and blast her pride!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O the blest gods! so will you wish on me,</div>
                     <div class="line">When the rash mood is on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Regan, thou shalt never have my curse:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy tender-hefted nature shall not give</div>
                     <div class="line">Thee o'er to harshness: her eyes are fierce; but thine</div>
                     <div class="line">Do comfort and not burn. 'Tis not in thee</div>
                     <div class="line">To grudge my pleasures, to cut off my train,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bandy hasty words, to scant my sizes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in conclusion to oppose the bolt</div>
                     <div class="line">Against my coming in: thou better know'st</div>
                     <div class="line">The offices of nature, bond of childhood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Effects of courtesy, dues of gratitude;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy half o' the kingdom hast thou not forgot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein I thee endow'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sir, to the purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Who put my man i' the stocks?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Tucket within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">What trumpet's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I know't, my sister's: this approves her letter,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she would soon be here.</div>
                     <p>Enter OSWALD</p>
                     <div class="line">Is your lady come?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a slave, whose easy-borrow'd pride</div>
                     <div class="line">Dwells in the fickle grace of her he follows.</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, varlet, from my sight!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">What means your grace?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Who stock'd my servant? Regan, I have good hope</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou didst not know on't. Who comes here? O heavens,</div>
                     <p>Enter GONERIL</p>
                     <div class="line">If you do love old men, if your sweet sway</div>
                     <div class="line">Allow obedience, if yourselves are old,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make it your cause; send down, and take my part!</div>
                     <p>To GONERIL</p>
                     <div class="line">Art not ashamed to look upon this beard?</div>
                     <div class="line">O Regan, wilt thou take her by the hand?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Why not by the hand, sir? How have I offended?</div>
                     <div class="line">All's not offence that indiscretion finds</div>
                     <div class="line">And dotage terms so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">O sides, you are too tough;</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you yet hold? How came my man i' the stocks?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">I set him there, sir: but his own disorders</div>
                     <div class="line">Deserved much less advancement.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">You! did you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, father, being weak, seem so.</div>
                     <div class="line">If, till the expiration of your month,</div>
                     <div class="line">You will return and sojourn with my sister,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dismissing half your train, come then to me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am now from home, and out of that provision</div>
                     <div class="line">Which shall be needful for your entertainment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Return to her, and fifty men dismiss'd?</div>
                     <div class="line">No, rather I abjure all roofs, and choose</div>
                     <div class="line">To wage against the enmity o' the air;</div>
                     <div class="line">To be a comrade with the wolf and owl,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Necessity's sharp pinch! Return with her?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, the hot-blooded France, that dowerless took</div>
                     <div class="line">Our youngest born, I could as well be brought</div>
                     <div class="line">To knee his throne, and, squire-like; pension beg</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep base life afoot. Return with her?</div>
                     <div class="line">Persuade me rather to be slave and sumpter</div>
                     <div class="line">To this detested groom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Pointing at OSWALD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">At your choice, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, daughter, do not make me mad:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not trouble thee, my child; farewell:</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll no more meet, no more see one another:</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet thou art my flesh, my blood, my daughter;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or rather a disease that's in my flesh,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I must needs call mine: thou art a boil,</div>
                     <div class="line">A plague-sore, an embossed carbuncle,</div>
                     <div class="line">In my corrupted blood. But I'll not chide thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let shame come when it will, I do not call it:</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not bid the thunder-bearer shoot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor tell tales of thee to high-judging Jove:</div>
                     <div class="line">Mend when thou canst; be better at thy leisure:</div>
                     <div class="line">I can be patient; I can stay with Regan,</div>
                     <div class="line">I and my hundred knights.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Not altogether so:</div>
                     <div class="line">I look'd not for you yet, nor am provided</div>
                     <div class="line">For your fit welcome. Give ear, sir, to my sister;</div>
                     <div class="line">For those that mingle reason with your passion</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be content to think you old, and so--</div>
                     <div class="line">But she knows what she does.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this well spoken?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare avouch it, sir: what, fifty followers?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it not well? What should you need of more?</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, or so many, sith that both charge and danger</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak 'gainst so great a number? How, in one house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should many people, under two commands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold amity? 'Tis hard; almost impossible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Why might not you, my lord, receive attendance</div>
                     <div class="line">From those that she calls servants or from mine?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Why not, my lord? If then they chanced to slack you,</div>
                     <div class="line">We could control them. If you will come to me,--</div>
                     <div class="line">For now I spy a danger,--I entreat you</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring but five and twenty: to no more</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I give place or notice.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">I gave you all--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">And in good time you gave it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Made you my guardians, my depositaries;</div>
                     <div class="line">But kept a reservation to be follow'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With such a number. What, must I come to you</div>
                     <div class="line">With five and twenty, Regan? said you so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">And speak't again, my lord; no more with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Those wicked creatures yet do look well-favour'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">When others are more wicked: not being the worst</div>
                     <div class="line">Stands in some rank of praise.</div>
                     <p>To GONERIL</p>
                     <div class="line">I'll go with thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy fifty yet doth double five and twenty,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou art twice her love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me, my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">What need you five and twenty, ten, or five,</div>
                     <div class="line">To follow in a house where twice so many</div>
                     <div class="line">Have a command to tend you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">What need one?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, reason not the need: our basest beggars</div>
                     <div class="line">Are in the poorest thing superfluous:</div>
                     <div class="line">Allow not nature more than nature needs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Man's life's as cheap as beast's: thou art a lady;</div>
                     <div class="line">If only to go warm were gorgeous,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, nature needs not what thou gorgeous wear'st,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which scarcely keeps thee warm. But, for true need,--</div>
                     <div class="line">You heavens, give me that patience, patience I need!</div>
                     <div class="line">You see me here, you gods, a poor old man,</div>
                     <div class="line">As full of grief as age; wretched in both!</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be you that stir these daughters' hearts</div>
                     <div class="line">Against their father, fool me not so much</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear it tamely; touch me with noble anger,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let not women's weapons, water-drops,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stain my man's cheeks! No, you unnatural hags,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will have such revenges on you both,</div>
                     <div class="line">That all the world shall--I will do such things,--</div>
                     <div class="line">What they are, yet I know not: but they shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">The terrors of the earth. You think I'll weep</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I'll not weep:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have full cause of weeping; but this heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall break into a hundred thousand flaws,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or ere I'll weep. O fool, I shall go mad!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt KING LEAR, GLOUCESTER, KENT, and Fool</p>
               <p>Storm and tempest</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us withdraw; 'twill be a storm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">This house is little: the old man and his people</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot be well bestow'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis his own blame; hath put himself from rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">And must needs taste his folly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">For his particular, I'll receive him gladly,</div>
                     <div class="line">But not one follower.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">So am I purposed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is my lord of Gloucester?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Follow'd the old man forth: he is return'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter GLOUCESTER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">The king is in high rage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither is he going?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">He calls to horse; but will I know not whither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis best to give him way; he leads himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, entreat him by no means to stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, the night comes on, and the bleak winds</div>
                     <div class="line">Do sorely ruffle; for many miles about</div>
                     <div class="line">There's scarce a bush.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sir, to wilful men,</div>
                     <div class="line">The injuries that they themselves procure</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be their schoolmasters. Shut up your doors:</div>
                     <div class="line">He is attended with a desperate train;</div>
                     <div class="line">And what they may incense him to, being apt</div>
                     <div class="line">To have his ear abused, wisdom bids fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Shut up your doors, my lord; 'tis a wild night:</div>
                     <div class="line">My Regan counsels well; come out o' the storm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I. A heath.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II. Another part of the heath. Storm still.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III. Gloucester's castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV. The heath. Before a hovel.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.6">5. SCENE V. Gloucester's castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
