                     <div class="line">trumpet: he is bold in his defence.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Sound!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>First trumpet</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Herald</div>
                     <div class="line">Again!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Second trumpet</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Herald</div>
                     <div class="line">Again!</div>
                     <p>Third trumpet</p>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Trumpet answers within</p>
               <p>Enter EDGAR, at the third sound, armed, with a trumpet before him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ask him his purposes, why he appears</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon this call o' the trumpet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Herald</div>
                     <div class="line">What are you?</div>
                     <div class="line">Your name, your quality? and why you answer</div>
                     <div class="line">This present summons?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Know, my name is lost;</div>
                     <div class="line">By treason's tooth bare-gnawn and canker-bit:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet am I noble as the adversary</div>
                     <div class="line">I come to cope.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is that adversary?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">What's he that speaks for Edmund Earl of Gloucester?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Himself: what say'st thou to him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Draw thy sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, if my speech offend a noble heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy arm may do thee justice: here is mine.</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold, it is the privilege of mine honours,</div>
                     <div class="line">My oath, and my profession: I protest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Maugre thy strength, youth, place, and eminence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Despite thy victor sword and fire-new fortune,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy valour and thy heart, thou art a traitor;</div>
                     <div class="line">False to thy gods, thy brother, and thy father;</div>
                     <div class="line">Conspirant 'gainst this high-illustrious prince;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, from the extremest upward of thy head</div>
                     <div class="line">To the descent and dust below thy foot,</div>
                     <div class="line">A most toad-spotted traitor. Say thou 'No,'</div>
                     <div class="line">This sword, this arm, and my best spirits, are bent</div>
                     <div class="line">To prove upon thy heart, whereto I speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou liest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">In wisdom I should ask thy name;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, since thy outside looks so fair and warlike,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that thy tongue some say of breeding breathes,</div>
                     <div class="line">What safe and nicely I might well delay</div>
                     <div class="line">By rule of knighthood, I disdain and spurn:</div>
                     <div class="line">Back do I toss these treasons to thy head;</div>
                     <div class="line">With the hell-hated lie o'erwhelm thy heart;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, for they yet glance by and scarcely bruise,</div>
                     <div class="line">This sword of mine shall give them instant way,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where they shall rest for ever. Trumpets, speak!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Alarums. They fight. EDMUND falls</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Save him, save him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">This is practise, Gloucester:</div>
                     <div class="line">By the law of arms thou wast not bound to answer</div>
                     <div class="line">An unknown opposite; thou art not vanquish'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">But cozen'd and beguiled.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Shut your mouth, dame,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or with this paper shall I stop it: Hold, sir:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou worse than any name, read thine own evil:</div>
                     <div class="line">No tearing, lady: I perceive you know it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Gives the letter to EDMUND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, if I do, the laws are mine, not thine:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who can arraign me for't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Most monstrous! oh!</div>
                     <div class="line">Know'st thou this paper?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                     <div class="line">Ask me not what I know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Go after her: she's desperate; govern her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">What you have charged me with, that have I done;</div>
                     <div class="line">And more, much more; the time will bring it out:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis past, and so am I. But what art thou</div>
                     <div class="line">That hast this fortune on me? If thou'rt noble,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do forgive thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's exchange charity.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am no less in blood than thou art, Edmund;</div>
                     <div class="line">If more, the more thou hast wrong'd me.</div>
                     <div class="line">My name is Edgar, and thy father's son.</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods are just, and of our pleasant vices</div>
                     <div class="line">Make instruments to plague us:</div>
                     <div class="line">The dark and vicious place where thee he got</div>
                     <div class="line">Cost him his eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast spoken right, 'tis true;</div>
                     <div class="line">The wheel is come full circle: I am here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought thy very gait did prophesy</div>
                     <div class="line">A royal nobleness: I must embrace thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let sorrow split my heart, if ever I</div>
                     <div class="line">Did hate thee or thy father!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthy prince, I know't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Where have you hid yourself?</div>
                     <div class="line">How have you known the miseries of your father?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">By nursing them, my lord. List a brief tale;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when 'tis told, O, that my heart would burst!</div>
                     <div class="line">The bloody proclamation to escape,</div>
                     <div class="line">That follow'd me so near,--O, our lives' sweetness!</div>
                     <div class="line">That we the pain of death would hourly die</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather than die at once!--taught me to shift</div>
                     <div class="line">Into a madman's rags; to assume a semblance</div>
                     <div class="line">That very dogs disdain'd: and in this habit</div>
                     <div class="line">Met I my father with his bleeding rings,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their precious stones new lost: became his guide,</div>
                     <div class="line">Led him, begg'd for him, saved him from despair;</div>
                     <div class="line">Never,--O fault!--reveal'd myself unto him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until some half-hour past, when I was arm'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">Not sure, though hoping, of this good success,</div>
                     <div class="line">I ask'd his blessing, and from first to last</div>
                     <div class="line">Told him my pilgrimage: but his flaw'd heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, too weak the conflict to support!</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twixt two extremes of passion, joy and grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">Burst smilingly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">This speech of yours hath moved me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shall perchance do good: but speak you on;</div>
                     <div class="line">You look as you had something more to say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">If there be more, more woeful, hold it in;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am almost ready to dissolve,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hearing of this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">This would have seem'd a period</div>
                     <div class="line">To such as love not sorrow; but another,</div>
                     <div class="line">To amplify too much, would make much more,</div>
                     <div class="line">And top extremity.</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst I was big in clamour came there in a man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, having seen me in my worst estate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shunn'd my abhorr'd society; but then, finding</div>
                     <div class="line">Who 'twas that so endured, with his strong arms</div>
                     <div class="line">He fastened on my neck, and bellow'd out</div>
                     <div class="line">As he'ld burst heaven; threw him on my father;</div>
                     <div class="line">Told the most piteous tale of Lear and him</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever ear received: which in recounting</div>
                     <div class="line">His grief grew puissant and the strings of life</div>
                     <div class="line">Began to crack: twice then the trumpets sounded,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there I left him tranced.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">But who was this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Kent, sir, the banish'd Kent; who in disguise</div>
                     <div class="line">Follow'd his enemy king, and did him service</div>
                     <div class="line">Improper for a slave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Gentleman, with a bloody knife</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Help, help, O, help!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">What kind of help?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">What means that bloody knife?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis hot, it smokes;</div>
                     <div class="line">It came even from the heart of--O, she's dead!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Who dead? speak, man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Your lady, sir, your lady: and her sister</div>
                     <div class="line">By her is poisoned; she hath confess'd it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I was contracted to them both: all three</div>
                     <div class="line">Now marry in an instant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes Kent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Produce their bodies, be they alive or dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">This judgment of the heavens, that makes us tremble,</div>
                     <div class="line">Touches us not with pity.</div>
                     <p>Exit Gentleman</p>
                     <p>Enter KENT</p>
                     <div class="line">O, is this he?</div>
                     <div class="line">The time will not allow the compliment</div>
                     <div class="line">Which very manners urges.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">I am come</div>
                     <div class="line">To bid my king and master aye good night:</div>
                     <div class="line">Is he not here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Great thing of us forgot!</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, Edmund, where's the king? and where's Cordelia?</div>
                     <div class="line">See'st thou this object, Kent?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The bodies of GONERIL and REGAN are brought in</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, why thus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet Edmund was beloved:</div>
                     <div class="line">The one the other poison'd for my sake,</div>
                     <div class="line">And after slew herself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Even so. Cover their faces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">I pant for life: some good I mean to do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Despite of mine own nature. Quickly send,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be brief in it, to the castle; for my writ</div>
                     <div class="line">Is on the life of Lear and on Cordelia:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, send in time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Run, run, O, run!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">To who, my lord? Who hath the office? send</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy token of reprieve.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">Well thought on: take my sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give it the captain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Haste thee, for thy life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit EDGAR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath commission from thy wife and me</div>
                     <div class="line">To hang Cordelia in the prison, and</div>
                     <div class="line">To lay the blame upon her own despair,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she fordid herself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods defend her! Bear him hence awhile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>EDMUND is borne off</p>
               <p>Re-enter KING LEAR, with CORDELIA dead in his arms; EDGAR,
                Captain, and others following</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Howl, howl, howl, howl! O, you are men of stones:</div>
                     <div class="line">Had I your tongues and eyes, I'ld use them so</div>
                     <div class="line">That heaven's vault should crack. She's gone for ever!</div>
                     <div class="line">I know when one is dead, and when one lives;</div>
                     <div class="line">She's dead as earth. Lend me a looking-glass;</div>
                     <div class="line">If that her breath will mist or stain the stone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then she lives.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the promised end</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Or image of that horror?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Fall, and cease!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">This feather stirs; she lives! if it be so,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a chance which does redeem all sorrows</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever I have felt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Kneeling</span> O my good
                    master!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis noble Kent, your friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">A plague upon you, murderers, traitors all!</div>
                     <div class="line">I might have saved her; now she's gone for ever!</div>
                     <div class="line">Cordelia, Cordelia! stay a little. Ha!</div>
                     <div class="line">What is't thou say'st? Her voice was ever soft,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentle, and low, an excellent thing in woman.</div>
                     <div class="line">I kill'd the slave that was a-hanging thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis true, my lords, he did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Did I not, fellow?</div>
                     <div class="line">I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have made them skip: I am old now,</div>
                     <div class="line">And these same crosses spoil me. Who are you?</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine eyes are not o' the best: I'll tell you straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">If fortune brag of two she loved and hated,</div>
                     <div class="line">One of them we behold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a dull sight. Are you not Kent?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">The same,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your servant Kent: Where is your servant Caius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">He's a good fellow, I can tell you that;</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll strike, and quickly too: he's dead and rotten.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my good lord; I am the very man,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll see that straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">That, from your first of difference and decay,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have follow'd your sad steps.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">You are welcome hither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor no man else: all's cheerless, dark, and deadly.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your eldest daughters have fordone them selves,</div>
                     <div class="line">And desperately are dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, so I think.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">He knows not what he says: and vain it is</div>
                     <div class="line">That we present us to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Very bootless.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Captain</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Edmund is dead, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">That's but a trifle here.</div>
                     <div class="line">You lords and noble friends, know our intent.</div>
                     <div class="line">What comfort to this great decay may come</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be applied: for us we will resign,</div>
                     <div class="line">During the life of this old majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">To him our absolute power:</div>
                     <p>To EDGAR and KENT</p>
                     <div class="line">you, to your rights:</div>
                     <div class="line">With boot, and such addition as your honours</div>
                     <div class="line">Have more than merited. All friends shall taste</div>
                     <div class="line">The wages of their virtue, and all foes</div>
                     <div class="line">The cup of their deservings. O, see, see!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                     <div class="line">And my poor fool is hang'd! No, no, no life!</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should a dog, a horse, a rat, have life,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou no breath at all? Thou'lt come no more,</div>
                     <div class="line">Never, never, never, never, never!</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, undo this button: thank you, sir.</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you see this? Look on her, look, her lips,</div>
                     <div class="line">Look there, look there!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">He faints! My lord, my lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Break, heart; I prithee, break!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Look up, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">Vex not his ghost: O, let him pass! he hates him much</div>
                     <div class="line">That would upon the rack of this tough world</div>
                     <div class="line">Stretch him out longer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                     <div class="line">He is gone, indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">The wonder is, he hath endured so long:</div>
                     <div class="line">He but usurp'd his life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear them from hence. Our present business</div>
                     <div class="line">Is general woe.</div>
                     <p>To KENT and EDGAR</p>
                     <div class="line">Friends of my soul, you twain</div>
                     <div class="line">Rule in this realm, and the gored state sustain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a journey, sir, shortly to go;</div>
                     <div class="line">My master calls me, I must not say no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                     <div class="line">The weight of this sad time we must obey;</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say.</div>
                     <div class="line">The oldest hath borne most: we that are young</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall never see so much, nor live so long.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt, with a dead march</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>
<html>
   <head>
      <link href="../../resources/css/db-prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/default.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <meta charset="utf-8"/>
      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>The Tragedy of King Lear</title>
   </head>
   <body>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           </span>

                           </span>

                           </span>

                           </span>

                music playing; Gentleman, and others attending.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>

                           </span>

                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III. The British camp near Dover.</a>
                           </span>

                  </li>

         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LEAR, king of Britain </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">KING OF FRANCE</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF BURGUNDY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF CORNWALL</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF ALBANY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EARL OF KENT</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EARL OF GLOUCESTER</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EDGAR, son to Gloucester.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EDMUND, bastard son to Gloucester.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CURAN, a courtier.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Old Man, tenant to Gloucester.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Doctor</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Fool</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">OSWALD, steward to Goneril.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Captain employed by Edmund. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Gentleman attendant on Cordelia. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Herald.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Servants to Cornwall.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">GONERIL</span>
                              <span class="personname">REGAN</span>
                              <span class="personname">CORDELIA</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">daughters to Lear.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Knights of Lear's train, Captains, Messengers, Soldiers, and
                Attendants</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE Britain.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I. King Lear's palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II. The Earl of Gloucester's castle.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III. The Duke of Albany's palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV. A hall in the same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE V. Court before the same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I. King Lear's palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter KENT, GLOUCESTER, and EDMUND</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">I thought the king had more affected the Duke of</div>
                              <div class="line">Albany than Cornwall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">It did always seem so to us: but now, in the</div>
                              <div class="line">division of the kingdom, it appears not which of</div>
                              <div class="line">the dukes he values most; for equalities are so</div>
                              <div class="line">weighed, that curiosity in neither can make choice</div>
                              <div class="line">of either's moiety.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Is not this your son, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">His breeding, sir, hath been at my charge: I have</div>
                              <div class="line">so often blushed to acknowledge him, that now I am</div>
                              <div class="line">brazed to it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot conceive you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, this young fellow's mother could: whereupon</div>
                              <div class="line">she grew round-wombed, and had, indeed, sir, a son</div>
                              <div class="line">for her cradle ere she had a husband for her bed.</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you smell a fault?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot wish the fault undone, the issue of it</div>
                              <div class="line">being so proper.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">But I have, sir, a son by order of law, some year</div>
                              <div class="line">elder than this, who yet is no dearer in my account:</div>
                              <div class="line">though this knave came something saucily into the</div>
                              <div class="line">world before he was sent for, yet was his mother</div>
                              <div class="line">fair; there was good sport at his making, and the</div>
                              <div class="line">whoreson must be acknowledged. Do you know this</div>
                              <div class="line">noble gentleman, Edmund?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                              <div class="line">No, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord of Kent: remember him hereafter as my</div>
                              <div class="line">honourable friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                              <div class="line">My services to your lordship.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">I must love you, and sue to know you better.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I shall study deserving.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath been out nine years, and away he shall</div>
                              <div class="line">again. The king is coming.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Sennet. Enter KING LEAR, CORNWALL, ALBANY, GONERIL, REGAN,
                CORDELIA, and Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Attend the lords of France and Burgundy, Gloucester.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall, my liege.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt GLOUCESTER and EDMUND</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Meantime we shall express our darker purpose.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me the map there. Know that we have divided</div>
                              <div class="line">In three our kingdom: and 'tis our fast intent</div>
                              <div class="line">To shake all cares and business from our age;</div>
                              <div class="line">Conferring them on younger strengths, while we</div>
                              <div class="line">Unburthen'd crawl toward death. Our son of Cornwall,</div>
                              <div class="line">And you, our no less loving son of Albany,</div>
                              <div class="line">We have this hour a constant will to publish</div>
                              <div class="line">Our daughters' several dowers, that future strife</div>
                              <div class="line">May be prevented now. The princes, France and Burgundy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Great rivals in our youngest daughter's love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Long in our court have made their amorous sojourn,</div>
                              <div class="line">And here are to be answer'd. Tell me, my daughters,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Since now we will divest us both of rule,</div>
                              <div class="line">Interest of territory, cares of state,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Which of you shall we say doth love us most?</div>
                              <div class="line">That we our largest bounty may extend</div>
                              <div class="line">Where nature doth with merit challenge. Goneril,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our eldest-born, speak first.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GONERIL</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I love you more than words can wield the matter;</div>
                              <div class="line">Dearer than eye-sight, space, and liberty;</div>
                              <div class="line">Beyond what can be valued, rich or rare;</div>
                              <div class="line">No less than life, with grace, health, beauty, honour;</div>
                              <div class="line">As much as child e'er loved, or father found;</div>
                              <div class="line">A love that makes breath poor, and speech unable;</div>
                              <div class="line">Beyond all manner of so much I love you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span> What shall Cordelia
                        do?</div>
                              <div class="line">Love, and be silent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all these bounds, even from this line to this,</div>
                              <div class="line">With shadowy forests and with champains rich'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">With plenteous rivers and wide-skirted meads,</div>
                              <div class="line">We make thee lady: to thine and Albany's issue</div>
                              <div class="line">Be this perpetual. What says our second daughter,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our dearest Regan, wife to Cornwall? Speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REGAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I am made</div>
                              <div class="line">Of the self-same metal that my sister is,</div>
                              <div class="line">And prize me at her worth. In my true heart</div>
                              <div class="line">I find she names my very deed of love;</div>
                              <div class="line">Only she comes too short: that I profess</div>
                              <div class="line">Myself an enemy to all other joys,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which the most precious square of sense possesses;</div>
                              <div class="line">And find I am alone felicitate</div>
                              <div class="line">In your dear highness' love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span> Then poor Cordelia!</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet not so; since, I am sure, my love's</div>
                              <div class="line">More richer than my tongue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">To thee and thine hereditary ever</div>
                              <div class="line">Remain this ample third of our fair kingdom;</div>
                              <div class="line">No less in space, validity, and pleasure,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than that conferr'd on Goneril. Now, our joy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Although the last, not least; to whose young love</div>
                              <div class="line">The vines of France and milk of Burgundy</div>
                              <div class="line">Strive to be interess'd; what can you say to draw</div>
                              <div class="line">A third more opulent than your sisters? Speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing will come of nothing: speak again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Unhappy that I am, I cannot heave</div>
                              <div class="line">My heart into my mouth: I love your majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">According to my bond; nor more nor less.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">How, how, Cordelia! mend your speech a little,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest it may mar your fortunes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">You have begot me, bred me, loved me: I</div>
                              <div class="line">Return those duties back as are right fit,</div>
                              <div class="line">Obey you, love you, and most honour you.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why have my sisters husbands, if they say</div>
                              <div class="line">They love you all? Haply, when I shall wed,</div>
                              <div class="line">That lord whose hand must take my plight shall carry</div>
                              <div class="line">Half my love with him, half my care and duty:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sure, I shall never marry like my sisters,</div>
                              <div class="line">To love my father all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">But goes thy heart with this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, good my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">So young, and so untender?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORDELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">So young, my lord, and true.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it be so; thy truth, then, be thy dower:</div>
                              <div class="line">For, by the sacred radiance of the sun,</div>
                              <div class="line">The mysteries of Hecate, and the night;</div>
                              <div class="line">By all the operation of the orbs</div>
                              <div class="line">From whom we do exist, and cease to be;</div>
                              <div class="line">Here I disclaim all my paternal care,</div>
                              <div class="line">Propinquity and property of blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">And as a stranger to my heart and me</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold thee, from this, for ever. The barbarous Scythian,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or he that makes his generation messes</div>
                              <div class="line">To gorge his appetite, shall to my bosom</div>
                              <div class="line">Be as well neighbour'd, pitied, and relieved,</div>
                              <div class="line">As thou my sometime daughter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my liege,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, Kent!</div>
                              <div class="line">Come not between the dragon and his wrath.</div>
                              <div class="line">I loved her most, and thought to set my rest</div>
                              <div class="line">On her kind nursery. Hence, and avoid my sight!</div>
                              <div class="line">So be my grave my peace, as here I give</div>
                              <div class="line">Her father's heart from her! Call France; who stirs?</div>
                              <div class="line">Call Burgundy. Cornwall and Albany,</div>
                              <div class="line">With my two daughters' dowers digest this third:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let pride, which she calls plainness, marry her.</div>
                              <div class="line">I do invest you jointly with my power,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pre-eminence, and all the large effects</div>
                              <div class="line">That troop with majesty. Ourself, by monthly course,</div>
                              <div class="line">With reservation of an hundred knights,</div>
                              <div class="line">By you to be sustain'd, shall our abode</div>
                              <div class="line">Make with you by due turns. Only we still retain</div>
                              <div class="line">The name, and all the additions to a king;</div>
                              <div class="line">The sway, revenue, execution of the rest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Beloved sons, be yours: which to confirm,</div>
                              <div class="line">This coronet part betwixt you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Giving the crown</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Royal Lear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom I have ever honour'd as my king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Loved as my father, as my master follow'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">As my great patron thought on in my prayers,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">The bow is bent and drawn, make from the shaft.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it fall rather, though the fork invade</div>
                              <div class="line">The region of my heart: be Kent unmannerly,</div>
                              <div class="line">When Lear is mad. What wilt thou do, old man?</div>
                              <div class="line">Think'st thou that duty shall have dread to speak,</div>
                              <div class="line">When power to flattery bows? To plainness honour's bound,</div>
                              <div class="line">When majesty stoops to folly. Reverse thy doom;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in thy best consideration, cheque</div>
                              <div class="line">This hideous rashness: answer my life my judgment,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy youngest daughter does not love thee least;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor are those empty-hearted whose low sound</div>
                              <div class="line">Reverbs no hollowness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Kent, on thy life, no more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">My life I never held but as a pawn</div>
                              <div class="line">To wage against thy enemies; nor fear to lose it,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy safety being the motive.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of my sight!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">See better, Lear; and let me still remain</div>
                              <div class="line">The true blank of thine eye.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by Apollo,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by Apollo, king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou swear'st thy gods in vain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">O, vassal! miscreant!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Laying his hand on his sword</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALBANY</div>
                              <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                              <div class="line">Dear sir, forbear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Do:</div>
                              <div class="line">Kill thy physician, and the fee bestow</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon thy foul disease. Revoke thy doom;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, whilst I can vent clamour from my throat,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll tell thee thou dost evil.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear me, recreant!</div>
                              <div class="line">On thine allegiance, hear me!</div>
                              <div class="line">Since thou hast sought to make us break our vow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which we durst never yet, and with strain'd pride</div>
                              <div class="line">To come between our sentence and our power,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which nor our nature nor our place can bear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our potency made good, take thy reward.</div>
                              <div class="line">Five days we do allot thee, for provision</div>
                              <div class="line">To shield thee from diseases of the world;</div>
                              <div class="line">And on the sixth to turn thy hated back</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon our kingdom: if, on the tenth day following,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy banish'd trunk be found in our dominions,</div>
                              <div class="line">The moment is thy death. Away! by Jupiter,</div>
                              <div class="line">This shall not be revoked.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Fare thee well, king: sith thus thou wilt appear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Freedom lives hence, and banishment is here.</div>
                              <p>To CORDELIA</p>
                              <div class="line">The gods to their dear shelter take thee, maid,</div>
                              <div class="line">That justly think'st, and hast most rightly said!</div>
                              <p>To REGAN and GONERIL</p>
                              <div class="line">And your large speeches may your deeds approve,</div>
                              <div class="line">That good effects may spring from words of love.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus Kent, O princes, bids you all adieu;</div>
                              <div class="line">He'll shape his old course in a country new.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Flourish. Re-enter GLOUCESTER, with KING OF FRANCE, BURGUNDY, and
                Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's France and Burgundy, my noble lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord of Burgundy.</div>
                              <div class="line">We first address towards you, who with this king</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath rivall'd for our daughter: what, in the least,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you require in present dower with her,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or cease your quest of love?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">Most royal majesty,</div>
                              <div class="line">I crave no more than what your highness offer'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor will you tender less.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Right noble Burgundy,</div>
                              <div class="line">When she was dear to us, we did hold her so;</div>
                              <div class="line">But now her price is fall'n. Sir, there she stands:</div>
                              <div class="line">If aught within that little seeming substance,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or all of it, with our displeasure pieced,</div>
                              <div class="line">And nothing more, may fitly like your grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">She's there, and she is yours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">I know no answer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you, with those infirmities she owes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unfriended, new-adopted to our hate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dower'd with our curse, and stranger'd with our oath,</div>
                              <div class="line">Take her, or leave her?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon me, royal sir;</div>
                              <div class="line">Election makes not up on such conditions.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Then leave her, sir; for, by the power that made me,</div>
                              <div class="line">I tell you all her wealth.</div>
                              <p>To KING OF FRANCE</p>
                              <div class="line">For you, great king,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not from your love make such a stray,</div>
                              <div class="line">To match you where I hate; therefore beseech you</div>
                              <div class="line">To avert your liking a more worthier way</div>
                              <div class="line">Than on a wretch whom nature is ashamed</div>
                              <div class="line">Almost to acknowledge hers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
