                              <div class="line">That things might change or cease; tears his white hair,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which the impetuous blasts, with eyeless rage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Catch in their fury, and make nothing of;</div>
                              <div class="line">Strives in his little world of man to out-scorn</div>
                              <div class="line">The to-and-fro-conflicting wind and rain.</div>
                              <div class="line">This night, wherein the cub-drawn bear would couch,</div>
                              <div class="line">The lion and the belly-pinched wolf</div>
                              <div class="line">Keep their fur dry, unbonneted he runs,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bids what will take all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">But who is with him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">None but the fool; who labours to out-jest</div>
                              <div class="line">His heart-struck injuries.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I do know you;</div>
                              <div class="line">And dare, upon the warrant of my note,</div>
                              <div class="line">Commend a dear thing to you. There is division,</div>
                              <div class="line">Although as yet the face of it be cover'd</div>
                              <div class="line">With mutual cunning, 'twixt Albany and Cornwall;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who have--as who have not, that their great stars</div>
                              <div class="line">Throned and set high?--servants, who seem no less,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which are to France the spies and speculations</div>
                              <div class="line">Intelligent of our state; what hath been seen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Either in snuffs and packings of the dukes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or the hard rein which both of them have borne</div>
                              <div class="line">Against the old kind king; or something deeper,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereof perchance these are but furnishings;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, true it is, from France there comes a power</div>
                              <div class="line">Into this scatter'd kingdom; who already,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wise in our negligence, have secret feet</div>
                              <div class="line">In some of our best ports, and are at point</div>
                              <div class="line">To show their open banner. Now to you:</div>
                              <div class="line">If on my credit you dare build so far</div>
                              <div class="line">To make your speed to Dover, you shall find</div>
                              <div class="line">Some that will thank you, making just report</div>
                              <div class="line">Of how unnatural and bemadding sorrow</div>
                              <div class="line">The king hath cause to plain.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am a gentleman of blood and breeding;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, from some knowledge and assurance, offer</div>
                              <div class="line">This office to you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">I will talk further with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">No, do not.</div>
                              <div class="line">For confirmation that I am much more</div>
                              <div class="line">Than my out-wall, open this purse, and take</div>
                              <div class="line">What it contains. If you shall see Cordelia,--</div>
                              <div class="line">As fear not but you shall,--show her this ring;</div>
                              <div class="line">And she will tell you who your fellow is</div>
                              <div class="line">That yet you do not know. Fie on this storm!</div>
                              <div class="line">I will go seek the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me your hand: have you no more to say?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Few words, but, to effect, more than all yet;</div>
                              <div class="line">That, when we have found the king,--in which your pain</div>
                              <div class="line">That way, I'll this,--he that first lights on him</div>
                              <div class="line">Holla the other.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt severally</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II. Another part of the heath. Storm still.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter KING LEAR and Fool</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!</div>
                              <div class="line">You cataracts and hurricanoes, spout</div>
                              <div class="line">Till you have drench'd our steeples, drown'd the cocks!</div>
                              <div class="line">You sulphurous and thought-executing fires,</div>
                              <div class="line">Vaunt-couriers to oak-cleaving thunderbolts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Singe my white head! And thou, all-shaking thunder,</div>
                              <div class="line">Smite flat the thick rotundity o' the world!</div>
                              <div class="line">Crack nature's moulds, an germens spill at once,</div>
                              <div class="line">That make ingrateful man!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">O nuncle, court holy-water in a dry</div>
                              <div class="line">house is better than this rain-water out o' door.</div>
                              <div class="line">Good nuncle, in, and ask thy daughters' blessing:</div>
                              <div class="line">here's a night pities neither wise man nor fool.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Rumble thy bellyful! Spit, fire! spout, rain!</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor rain, wind, thunder, fire, are my daughters:</div>
                              <div class="line">I tax not you, you elements, with unkindness;</div>
                              <div class="line">I never gave you kingdom, call'd you children,</div>
                              <div class="line">You owe me no subscription: then let fall</div>
                              <div class="line">Your horrible pleasure: here I stand, your slave,</div>
                              <div class="line">A poor, infirm, weak, and despised old man:</div>
                              <div class="line">But yet I call you servile ministers,</div>
                              <div class="line">That have with two pernicious daughters join'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Your high engender'd battles 'gainst a head</div>
                              <div class="line">So old and white as this. O! O! 'tis foul!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">He that has a house to put's head in has a good</div>
                              <div class="line">head-piece.</div>
                              <div class="line">The cod-piece that will house</div>
                              <div class="line">Before the head has any,</div>
                              <div class="line">The head and he shall louse;</div>
                              <div class="line">So beggars marry many.</div>
                              <div class="line">The man that makes his toe</div>
                              <div class="line">What he his heart should make</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall of a corn cry woe,</div>
                              <div class="line">And turn his sleep to wake.</div>
                              <div class="line">For there was never yet fair woman but she made</div>
                              <div class="line">mouths in a glass.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">No, I will be the pattern of all patience;</div>
                              <div class="line">I will say nothing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter KENT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Who's there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, here's grace and a cod-piece; that's a wise</div>
                              <div class="line">man and a fool.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, sir, are you here? things that love night</div>
                              <div class="line">Love not such nights as these; the wrathful skies</div>
                              <div class="line">Gallow the very wanderers of the dark,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make them keep their caves: since I was man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such sheets of fire, such bursts of horrid thunder,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such groans of roaring wind and rain, I never</div>
                              <div class="line">Remember to have heard: man's nature cannot carry</div>
                              <div class="line">The affliction nor the fear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Let the great gods,</div>
                              <div class="line">That keep this dreadful pother o'er our heads,</div>
                              <div class="line">Find out their enemies now. Tremble, thou wretch,</div>
                              <div class="line">That hast within thee undivulged crimes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unwhipp'd of justice: hide thee, thou bloody hand;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou perjured, and thou simular man of virtue</div>
                              <div class="line">That art incestuous: caitiff, to pieces shake,</div>
                              <div class="line">That under covert and convenient seeming</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast practised on man's life: close pent-up guilts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rive your concealing continents, and cry</div>
                              <div class="line">These dreadful summoners grace. I am a man</div>
                              <div class="line">More sinn'd against than sinning.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Alack, bare-headed!</div>
                              <div class="line">Gracious my lord, hard by here is a hovel;</div>
                              <div class="line">Some friendship will it lend you 'gainst the tempest:</div>
                              <div class="line">Repose you there; while I to this hard house--</div>
                              <div class="line">More harder than the stones whereof 'tis raised;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which even but now, demanding after you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Denied me to come in--return, and force</div>
                              <div class="line">Their scanted courtesy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">My wits begin to turn.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come on, my boy: how dost, my boy? art cold?</div>
                              <div class="line">I am cold myself. Where is this straw, my fellow?</div>
                              <div class="line">The art of our necessities is strange,</div>
                              <div class="line">That can make vile things precious. Come,</div>
                              <div class="line">your hovel.</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor fool and knave, I have one part in my heart</div>
                              <div class="line">That's sorry yet for thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Singing</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">He that has and a little tiny wit--</div>
                              <div class="line">With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Must make content with his fortunes fit,</div>
                              <div class="line">For the rain it raineth every day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">True, my good boy. Come, bring us to this hovel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt KING LEAR and KENT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">This is a brave night to cool a courtezan.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll speak a prophecy ere I go:</div>
                              <div class="line">When priests are more in word than matter;</div>
                              <div class="line">When brewers mar their malt with water;</div>
                              <div class="line">When nobles are their tailors' tutors;</div>
                              <div class="line">No heretics burn'd, but wenches' suitors;</div>
                              <div class="line">When every case in law is right;</div>
                              <div class="line">No squire in debt, nor no poor knight;</div>
                              <div class="line">When slanders do not live in tongues;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor cutpurses come not to throngs;</div>
                              <div class="line">When usurers tell their gold i' the field;</div>
                              <div class="line">And bawds and whores do churches build;</div>
                              <div class="line">Then shall the realm of Albion</div>
                              <div class="line">Come to great confusion:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then comes the time, who lives to see't,</div>
                              <div class="line">That going shall be used with feet.</div>
                              <div class="line">This prophecy Merlin shall make; for I live before his
                    time.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III. Gloucester's castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER and EDMUND</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Alack, alack, Edmund, I like not this unnatural</div>
                              <div class="line">dealing. When I desire their leave that I might</div>
                              <div class="line">pity him, they took from me the use of mine own</div>
                              <div class="line">house; charged me, on pain of their perpetual</div>
                              <div class="line">displeasure, neither to speak of him, entreat for</div>
                              <div class="line">him, nor any way sustain him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                              <div class="line">Most savage and unnatural!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to; say you nothing. There's a division betwixt</div>
                              <div class="line">the dukes; and a worse matter than that: I have</div>
                              <div class="line">received a letter this night; 'tis dangerous to be</div>
                              <div class="line">spoken; I have locked the letter in my closet:</div>
                              <div class="line">these injuries the king now bears will be revenged</div>
                              <div class="line">home; there's part of a power already footed: we</div>
                              <div class="line">must incline to the king. I will seek him, and</div>
                              <div class="line">privily relieve him: go you and maintain talk with</div>
                              <div class="line">the duke, that my charity be not of him perceived:</div>
                              <div class="line">if he ask for me. I am ill, and gone to bed.</div>
                              <div class="line">Though I die for it, as no less is threatened me,</div>
                              <div class="line">the king my old master must be relieved. There is</div>
                              <div class="line">some strange thing toward, Edmund; pray you, be
                    careful.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                              <div class="line">This courtesy, forbid thee, shall the duke</div>
                              <div class="line">Instantly know; and of that letter too:</div>
                              <div class="line">This seems a fair deserving, and must draw me</div>
                              <div class="line">That which my father loses; no less than all:</div>
                              <div class="line">The younger rises when the old doth fall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV. The heath. Before a hovel.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter KING LEAR, KENT, and Fool</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is the place, my lord; good my lord, enter:</div>
                              <div class="line">The tyranny of the open night's too rough</div>
                              <div class="line">For nature to endure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Storm still</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me alone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my lord, enter here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt break my heart?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather break mine own. Good my lord, enter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou think'st 'tis much that this contentious storm</div>
                              <div class="line">Invades us to the skin: so 'tis to thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">But where the greater malady is fix'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">The lesser is scarce felt. Thou'ldst shun a bear;</div>
                              <div class="line">But if thy flight lay toward the raging sea,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou'ldst meet the bear i' the mouth. When the</div>
                              <div class="line">mind's free,</div>
                              <div class="line">The body's delicate: the tempest in my mind</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth from my senses take all feeling else</div>
                              <div class="line">Save what beats there. Filial ingratitude!</div>
                              <div class="line">Is it not as this mouth should tear this hand</div>
                              <div class="line">For lifting food to't? But I will punish home:</div>
                              <div class="line">No, I will weep no more. In such a night</div>
                              <div class="line">To shut me out! Pour on; I will endure.</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a night as this! O Regan, Goneril!</div>
                              <div class="line">Your old kind father, whose frank heart gave all,--</div>
                              <div class="line">O, that way madness lies; let me shun that;</div>
                              <div class="line">No more of that.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my lord, enter here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Prithee, go in thyself: seek thine own ease:</div>
                              <div class="line">This tempest will not give me leave to ponder</div>
                              <div class="line">On things would hurt me more. But I'll go in.</div>
                              <p>To the Fool</p>
                              <div class="line">In, boy; go first. You houseless poverty,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, get thee in. I'll pray, and then I'll sleep.</div>
                              <p>Fool goes in</p>
                              <div class="line">Poor naked wretches, whereso'er you are,</div>
                              <div class="line">That bide the pelting of this pitiless storm,</div>
                              <div class="line">How shall your houseless heads and unfed sides,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your loop'd and window'd raggedness, defend you</div>
                              <div class="line">From seasons such as these? O, I have ta'en</div>
                              <div class="line">Too little care of this! Take physic, pomp;</div>
                              <div class="line">Expose thyself to feel what wretches feel,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou mayst shake the superflux to them,</div>
                              <div class="line">And show the heavens more just.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Within</span> Fathom and half,
                        fathom and half! Poor Tom!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The Fool runs out from the hovel</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">Come not in here, nuncle, here's a spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">Help me, help me!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me thy hand. Who's there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">A spirit, a spirit: he says his name's poor Tom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">What art thou that dost grumble there i' the straw?</div>
                              <div class="line">Come forth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter EDGAR disguised as a mad man</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Away! the foul fiend follows me!</div>
                              <div class="line">Through the sharp hawthorn blows the cold wind.</div>
                              <div class="line">Hum! go to thy cold bed, and warm thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast thou given all to thy two daughters?</div>
                              <div class="line">And art thou come to this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Who gives any thing to poor Tom? whom the foul</div>
                              <div class="line">fiend hath led through fire and through flame, and</div>
                              <div class="line">through ford and whirlipool e'er bog and quagmire;</div>
                              <div class="line">that hath laid knives under his pillow, and halters</div>
                              <div class="line">in his pew; set ratsbane by his porridge; made film</div>
                              <div class="line">proud of heart, to ride on a bay trotting-horse over</div>
                              <div class="line">four-inched bridges, to course his own shadow for a</div>
                              <div class="line">traitor. Bless thy five wits! Tom's a-cold,--O, do</div>
                              <div class="line">de, do de, do de. Bless thee from whirlwinds,</div>
                              <div class="line">star-blasting, and taking! Do poor Tom some</div>
                              <div class="line">charity, whom the foul fiend vexes: there could I</div>
                              <div class="line">have him now,--and there,--and there again, and there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Storm still</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">What, have his daughters brought him to this pass?</div>
                              <div class="line">Couldst thou save nothing? Didst thou give them all?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, he reserved a blanket, else we had been all
                    shamed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, all the plagues that in the pendulous air</div>
                              <div class="line">Hang fated o'er men's faults light on thy daughters!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath no daughters, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Death, traitor! nothing could have subdued nature</div>
                              <div class="line">To such a lowness but his unkind daughters.</div>
                              <div class="line">Is it the fashion, that discarded fathers</div>
                              <div class="line">Should have thus little mercy on their flesh?</div>
                              <div class="line">Judicious punishment! 'twas this flesh begot</div>
                              <div class="line">Those pelican daughters.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Pillicock sat on Pillicock-hill:</div>
                              <div class="line">Halloo, halloo, loo, loo!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">This cold night will turn us all to fools and madmen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Take heed o' the foul fiend: obey thy parents;</div>
                              <div class="line">keep thy word justly; swear not; commit not with</div>
                              <div class="line">man's sworn spouse; set not thy sweet heart on proud</div>
                              <div class="line">array. Tom's a-cold.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">What hast thou been?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">A serving-man, proud in heart and mind; that curled</div>
                              <div class="line">my hair; wore gloves in my cap; served the lust of</div>
                              <div class="line">my mistress' heart, and did the act of darkness with</div>
                              <div class="line">her; swore as many oaths as I spake words, and</div>
                              <div class="line">broke them in the sweet face of heaven: one that</div>
                              <div class="line">slept in the contriving of lust, and waked to do it:</div>
                              <div class="line">wine loved I deeply, dice dearly: and in woman</div>
                              <div class="line">out-paramoured the Turk: false of heart, light of</div>
                              <div class="line">ear, bloody of hand; hog in sloth, fox in stealth,</div>
                              <div class="line">wolf in greediness, dog in madness, lion in prey.</div>
                              <div class="line">Let not the creaking of shoes nor the rustling of</div>
                              <div class="line">silks betray thy poor heart to woman: keep thy foot</div>
                              <div class="line">out of brothels, thy hand out of plackets, thy pen</div>
                              <div class="line">from lenders' books, and defy the foul fiend.</div>
                              <div class="line">Still through the hawthorn blows the cold wind:</div>
                              <div class="line">Says suum, mun, ha, no, nonny.</div>
                              <div class="line">Dolphin my boy, my boy, sessa! let him trot by.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Storm still</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, thou wert better in thy grave than to answer</div>
                              <div class="line">with thy uncovered body this extremity of the skies.</div>
                              <div class="line">Is man no more than this? Consider him well. Thou</div>
                              <div class="line">owest the worm no silk, the beast no hide, the sheep</div>
                              <div class="line">no wool, the cat no perfume. Ha! here's three on</div>
                              <div class="line">'s are sophisticated! Thou art the thing itself:</div>
                              <div class="line">unaccommodated man is no more but such a poor bare,</div>
                              <div class="line">forked animal as thou art. Off, off, you lendings!</div>
                              <div class="line">come unbutton here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Tearing off his clothes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">Prithee, nuncle, be contented; 'tis a naughty night</div>
                              <div class="line">to swim in. Now a little fire in a wild field were</div>
                              <div class="line">like an old lecher's heart; a small spark, all the</div>
                              <div class="line">rest on's body cold. Look, here comes a walking fire.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER, with a torch</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the foul fiend Flibbertigibbet: he begins</div>
                              <div class="line">at curfew, and walks till the first cock; he gives</div>
                              <div class="line">the web and the pin, squints the eye, and makes the</div>
                              <div class="line">hare-lip; mildews the white wheat, and hurts the</div>
                              <div class="line">poor creature of earth.</div>
                              <div class="line">S. Withold footed thrice the old;</div>
                              <div class="line">He met the night-mare, and her nine-fold;</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid her alight,</div>
                              <div class="line">And her troth plight,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, aroint thee, witch, aroint thee!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">How fares your grace?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">What's he?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Who's there? What is't you seek?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What are you there? Your names?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor Tom; that eats the swimming frog, the toad,</div>
                              <div class="line">the tadpole, the wall-newt and the water; that in</div>
                              <div class="line">the fury of his heart, when the foul fiend rages,</div>
                              <div class="line">eats cow-dung for sallets; swallows the old rat and</div>
                              <div class="line">the ditch-dog; drinks the green mantle of the</div>
                              <div class="line">standing pool; who is whipped from tithing to</div>
                              <div class="line">tithing, and stock- punished, and imprisoned; who</div>
                              <div class="line">hath had three suits to his back, six shirts to his</div>
                              <div class="line">body, horse to ride, and weapon to wear;</div>
                              <div class="line">But mice and rats, and such small deer,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have been Tom's food for seven long year.</div>
                              <div class="line">Beware my follower. Peace, Smulkin; peace, thou fiend!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What, hath your grace no better company?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">The prince of darkness is a gentleman:</div>
                              <div class="line">Modo he's call'd, and Mahu.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Our flesh and blood is grown so vile, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">That it doth hate what gets it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor Tom's a-cold.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Go in with me: my duty cannot suffer</div>
                              <div class="line">To obey in all your daughters' hard commands:</div>
                              <div class="line">Though their injunction be to bar my doors,</div>
                              <div class="line">And let this tyrannous night take hold upon you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet have I ventured to come seek you out,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bring you where both fire and food is ready.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">First let me talk with this philosopher.</div>
                              <div class="line">What is the cause of thunder?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my lord, take his offer; go into the house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll talk a word with this same learned Theban.</div>
                              <div class="line">What is your study?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">How to prevent the fiend, and to kill vermin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me ask you one word in private.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Importune him once more to go, my lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">His wits begin to unsettle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Canst thou blame him?</div>
                              <p>Storm still</p>
                              <div class="line">His daughters seek his death: ah, that good Kent!</div>
                              <div class="line">He said it would be thus, poor banish'd man!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou say'st the king grows mad; I'll tell thee, friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am almost mad myself: I had a son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now outlaw'd from my blood; he sought my life,</div>
                              <div class="line">But lately, very late: I loved him, friend;</div>
                              <div class="line">No father his son dearer: truth to tell thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">The grief hath crazed my wits. What a night's this!</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech your grace,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">O, cry your mercy, sir.</div>
                              <div class="line">Noble philosopher, your company.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Tom's a-cold.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">In, fellow, there, into the hovel: keep thee warm.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Come let's in all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">This way, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">With him;</div>
                              <div class="line">I will keep still with my philosopher.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my lord, soothe him; let him take the fellow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Take him you on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirrah, come on; go along with us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, good Athenian.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">No words, no words: hush.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Child Rowland to the dark tower came,</div>
                              <div class="line">His word was still,--Fie, foh, and fum,</div>
                              <div class="line">I smell the blood of a British man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V. Gloucester's castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter CORNWALL and EDMUND</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                              <div class="line">I will have my revenge ere I depart his house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                              <div class="line">How, my lord, I may be censured, that nature thus</div>
                              <div class="line">gives way to loyalty, something fears me to think</div>
                              <div class="line">of.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                              <div class="line">I now perceive, it was not altogether your</div>
                              <div class="line">brother's evil disposition made him seek his death;</div>
                              <div class="line">but a provoking merit, set a-work by a reprovable</div>
                              <div class="line">badness in himself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                              <div class="line">How malicious is my fortune, that I must repent to</div>
                              <div class="line">be just! This is the letter he spoke of, which</div>
                              <div class="line">approves him an intelligent party to the advantages</div>
                              <div class="line">of France: O heavens! that this treason were not,</div>
                              <div class="line">or not I the detector!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                              <div class="line">o with me to the duchess.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                              <div class="line">If the matter of this paper be certain, you have</div>
                              <div class="line">mighty business in hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                              <div class="line">True or false, it hath made thee earl of</div>
                              <div class="line">Gloucester. Seek out where thy father is, that he</div>
                              <div class="line">may be ready for our apprehension.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDMUND</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span> If I find him
                        comforting the king, it will</div>
                              <div class="line">stuff his suspicion more fully.--I will persevere in</div>
                              <div class="line">my course of loyalty, though the conflict be sore</div>
                              <div class="line">between that and my blood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORNWALL</div>
                              <div class="line">I will lay trust upon thee; and thou shalt find a</div>
                              <div class="line">dearer father in my love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.7">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>6. SCENE VI. A chamber in a farmhouse adjoining the castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER, KING LEAR, KENT, Fool, and EDGAR</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is better than the open air; take it</div>
                              <div class="line">thankfully. I will piece out the comfort with what</div>
                              <div class="line">addition I can: I will not be long from you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">All the power of his wits have given way to his</div>
                              <div class="line">impatience: the gods reward your kindness!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit GLOUCESTER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Frateretto calls me; and tells me</div>
                              <div class="line">Nero is an angler in the lake of darkness.</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray, innocent, and beware the foul fiend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">Prithee, nuncle, tell me whether a madman be a</div>
                              <div class="line">gentleman or a yeoman?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">A king, a king!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">No, he's a yeoman that has a gentleman to his son;</div>
                              <div class="line">for he's a mad yeoman that sees his son a gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">before him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">To have a thousand with red burning spits</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hissing in upon 'em,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">The foul fiend bites my back.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">He's mad that trusts in the tameness of a wolf, a</div>
                              <div class="line">horse's health, a boy's love, or a whore's oath.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall be done; I will arraign them straight.</div>
                              <p>To EDGAR</p>
                              <div class="line">Come, sit thou here, most learned justicer;</div>
                              <p>To the Fool</p>
                              <div class="line">Thou, sapient sir, sit here. Now, you she foxes!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, where he stands and glares!</div>
                              <div class="line">Wantest thou eyes at trial, madam?</div>
                              <div class="line">Come o'er the bourn, Bessy, to me,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">Her boat hath a leak,</div>
                              <div class="line">And she must not speak</div>
                              <div class="line">Why she dares not come over to thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">The foul fiend haunts poor Tom in the voice of a</div>
                              <div class="line">nightingale. Hopdance cries in Tom's belly for two</div>
                              <div class="line">white herring. Croak not, black angel; I have no</div>
                              <div class="line">food for thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">How do you, sir? Stand you not so amazed:</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you lie down and rest upon the cushions?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll see their trial first. Bring in the evidence.</div>
                              <p>To EDGAR</p>
                              <div class="line">Thou robed man of justice, take thy place;</div>
                              <p>To the Fool</p>
                              <div class="line">And thou, his yoke-fellow of equity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bench by his side:</div>
                              <p>To KENT</p>
                              <div class="line">you are o' the commission,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sit you too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us deal justly.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sleepest or wakest thou, jolly shepherd?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy sheep be in the corn;</div>
                              <div class="line">And for one blast of thy minikin mouth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy sheep shall take no harm.</div>
                              <div class="line">Pur! the cat is gray.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Arraign her first; 'tis Goneril. I here take my</div>
                              <div class="line">oath before this honourable assembly, she kicked the</div>
                              <div class="line">poor king her father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, mistress. Is your name Goneril?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">She cannot deny it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">Cry you mercy, I took you for a joint-stool.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">And here's another, whose warp'd looks proclaim</div>
                              <div class="line">What store her heart is made on. Stop her there!</div>
                              <div class="line">Arms, arms, sword, fire! Corruption in the place!</div>
                              <div class="line">False justicer, why hast thou let her 'scape?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Bless thy five wits!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">O pity! Sir, where is the patience now,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou so oft have boasted to retain?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span> My tears begin to
                        take his part so much,</div>
                              <div class="line">They'll mar my counterfeiting.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">The little dogs and all, Tray, Blanch, and</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet-heart, see, they bark at me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Tom will throw his head at them. Avaunt, you curs!</div>
                              <div class="line">Be thy mouth or black or white,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tooth that poisons if it bite;</div>
                              <div class="line">Mastiff, grey-hound, mongrel grim,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hound or spaniel, brach or lym,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or bobtail tike or trundle-tail,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tom will make them weep and wail:</div>
                              <div class="line">For, with throwing thus my head,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dogs leap the hatch, and all are fled.</div>
                              <div class="line">Do de, de, de. Sessa! Come, march to wakes and</div>
                              <div class="line">fairs and market-towns. Poor Tom, thy horn is dry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Then let them anatomize Regan; see what breeds</div>
                              <div class="line">about her heart. Is there any cause in nature that</div>
                              <div class="line">makes these hard hearts?</div>
                              <p>To EDGAR</p>
                              <div class="line">You, sir, I entertain for one of my hundred; only I</div>
                              <div class="line">do not like the fashion of your garments: you will</div>
                              <div class="line">say they are Persian attire: but let them be changed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, good my lord, lie here and rest awhile.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Make no noise, make no noise; draw the curtains:</div>
                              <div class="line">so, so, so. We'll go to supper i' he morning. So, so,
                    so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fool</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll go to bed at noon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter GLOUCESTER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, friend: where is the king my master?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, sir; but trouble him not, his wits are gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Good friend, I prithee, take him in thy arms;</div>
                              <div class="line">I have o'erheard a plot of death upon him:</div>
                              <div class="line">There is a litter ready; lay him in 't,</div>
                              <div class="line">And drive towards Dover, friend, where thou shalt meet</div>
                              <div class="line">Both welcome and protection. Take up thy master:</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou shouldst dally half an hour, his life,</div>
                              <div class="line">With thine, and all that offer to defend him,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand in assured loss: take up, take up;</div>
                              <div class="line">And follow me, that will to some provision</div>
                              <div class="line">Give thee quick conduct.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KENT</div>
                              <div class="line">Oppressed nature sleeps:</div>
                              <div class="line">This rest might yet have balm'd thy broken senses,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, if convenience will not allow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand in hard cure.</div>
                              <p>To the Fool</p>
                              <div class="line">Come, help to bear thy master;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou must not stay behind.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but EDGAR</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDGAR</div>
                              <div class="line">When we our betters see bearing our woes,</div>
                              <div class="line">We scarcely think our miseries our foes.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who alone suffers suffers most i' the mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">Leaving free things and happy shows behind:</div>
                              <div class="line">But then the mind much sufferance doth o'er skip,</div>
                              <div class="line">When grief hath mates, and bearing fellowship.</div>
                              <div class="line">How light and portable my pain seems now,</div>
